name: Fundamental Computer Programming- PythonI

name: A Guide to Classics Teaching in English
description: In this interdisciplinary course, students will explore the theoretical and practical dimensions of teaching classical texts in English, examining the historical, cultural, and pedagogical contexts that shape their interpretation and transmission. name: Japanese Language Lab.I

name: Digital Literacy in the Age of AI Teaching in English

name: Japanese III
description: In this advanced course, FL252 Japanese III, students will further develop their proficiency in Japanese language skills, focusing on nuanced expression and comprehension of complex texts, including literature, media, and cultural materials. Through a combination of reading, writing, speaking, and listening exercises, students will refine their command of Japanese grammar, vocabulary, and syntax, enabling them to communicate effectively in a variety of contexts.

name: Japanese Speech I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of Japanese pronunciation, intonation, and basic speech patterns, emphasizing authentic communication and cultural understanding in the target language. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and pronunciation practice, students will develop their skills in Japanese speech and improve their ability to communicate effectively in everyday situations. By the end of the course, students will be able to engage in simple conversations and understand basic spoken Japanese.

name: Japanese Writing Practice I
description: This course introduces students to the art of Japanese writing, focusing on the fundamentals of kanji, hiragana, and katakana scripts. Students will learn to write and recognize the basic characters, as well as practice grammatical and stylistic nuances through various writing exercises and compositions. By the end of the course, students will be able to express themselves effectively in written Japanese.

name: Intercultural Communication Skills Teaching in English
description: In this course, FL258: Intercultural Communication Skills Teaching in English, students will develop the expertise to design and deliver effective English language instruction that caters to diverse cultural backgrounds and learning styles. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to navigate intercultural communication challenges and create inclusive learning environments. By the end of the course, students will be equipped to adapt their teaching approaches to meet the needs of students from various cultural contexts.

name: Introduction to Reading Skills in Japanese
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to reading skills in Japanese, covering basic kanji, kana, and vocabulary, as well as grammatical structures that underpin Japanese reading comprehension. Students will learn to read and analyze a variety of texts, including literature, news articles, and authentic materials, to develop a deeper understanding of Japanese culture and language. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and reading assignments, students will improve their reading skills and gain a solid foundation for further study in Japanese language and literature.

name: Practical English Writing Teaching in English
description: This course, FL267: Practical English Writing Teaching in English, equips students with the skills and knowledge to effectively teach writing in English language learning environments. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical application, students will learn to design and deliver writing instruction that addresses the needs of diverse learners. By the end of the course, students will be able to create engaging lesson plans and assessments that foster English writing proficiency.

name: Communication Theories and Practice Teaching in English 專業科技傳播學程
description: This course, FL321 Communication Theories and Practice Teaching in English, offers an in-depth exploration of communication theories and their practical applications in English language teaching. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will cultivate the skills necessary to critically analyze and apply communication theories in real-world teaching contexts.

name: English Teaching Materials and Activities Teaching in English
description: This course explores the design, development, and implementation of English teaching materials and activities for diverse language learners. Students will learn to create engaging and effective lesson plans, assess language proficiency, and incorporate technology-enhanced instruction, all while maintaining a focus on cultural sensitivity and language authenticity.

Through a comprehensive exploration of the industry's cultural, economic, and social aspects, students gain a nuanced understanding of its complexities and acquire skills in creative industry management.

name: Japanese Outside ReadingI
description: This course is an advanced reading course for students of Japanese language, focusing on complex literary texts and authentic materials to improve comprehension, vocabulary, and critical thinking skills. Through in-depth analysis and discussion, students will develop a deeper understanding of Japanese culture, history, and literary styles.

name: Japanese Outside ReadingII
description: This course, FL359 Japanese Outside Reading II, is a continuation of the first-year Japanese reading course, focusing on developing advanced reading, comprehension, and analysis skills through a wide range of authentic texts, including literary works, essays, and media. Students will improve their ability to critically evaluate and interpret complex written Japanese and enhance their overall linguistic proficiency.

name: Introduction to the English Language Teaching in English
description: In this undergraduate course, FL369: Introduction to the English Language Teaching in English, students will explore theoretical foundations and practical applications of English language instruction, examining effective teaching methods, materials, and assessment techniques. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will develop a deeper understanding of the English language and its complexities, as well as essential skills for teaching English language learners.

name: Speech and Debate Teaching in English
description: In this interdisciplinary course, FL373: Speech and Debate Teaching in English, students will develop the theoretical foundations and practical skills necessary to effectively teach public speaking, argumentation, and debate techniques to English language learners and native English speakers. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will learn how to design and deliver engaging lessons, assess student performance, and foster critical thinking, creativity, and effective communication skills in their students.

name: Work-Place English Teaching in English
description: This course, FL374 Work-Place English Teaching in English, equips students with the skills and knowledge necessary to design and deliver effective workplace English training programs. Through hands-on instruction and case studies, students will learn how to assess workplace language needs, develop tailored curricula, and implement teaching strategies that promote language acquisition and workplace competence. By the end of the course, students will be able to create and implement English language training programs that enhance employee performance and workplace productivity.

name: Reading and Discussion
description: In this advanced reading and discussion course (FL380), students will engage in nuanced analysis and debate of complex literary and cultural texts, developing their critical thinking and communication skills in the target language. Through in-depth exploration of selected works, students will hone their reading comprehension, vocabulary, and writing abilities, with a focus on effective expression and argumentation.

name: Advanced Japanese I
description: This advanced-level course, FL381 Advanced Japanese I, delves into the complexities of the Japanese language, focusing on nuanced grammatical structures, sophisticated vocabulary, and authentic cultural contexts. Students will engage in rigorous language practice, including listening, speaking, reading, and writing, to refine their communication skills and deepen their understanding of Japan's rich cultural heritage. By the end of the course, students will demonstrate advanced proficiency in Japanese language and cultural competency.

name: Introduction to Japanese Literature 數位文創出版產業學程
description: This course, Introduction to Japanese Literature, provides an in-depth exploration of Japan's rich literary heritage, covering the major genres, periods, and themes from classical to modern times. Students will engage with key works and authors, analyzing their cultural, historical, and artistic significance in the context of Japan's unique literary traditions. Through close readings and critical discussions, students will develop a nuanced understanding of Japan's literary identity and its ongoing influence on contemporary culture.

name: Advanced Japanese Listening
description: In this advanced course, students develop and refine their Japanese listening skills through authentic materials, including news broadcasts, documentaries, and native speaker dialogues. Emphasis is placed on improving comprehension, vocabulary acquisition, and nuanced understanding of cultural context, enabling students to engage with sophisticated Japanese media and communicate effectively in real-world situations. Upon completion, students demonstrate a high level of proficiency in Japanese listening skills.

name: Introduction of Economics Teaching in English
description: This course introduces students to the principles and methods of teaching economics in an English-language setting. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of economic concepts, develop effective teaching strategies, and learn to design engaging lesson plans and assessments. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and practical exercises, students will cultivate the skills necessary to deliver high-quality economics instruction in an English-speaking environment.

name: Japanese Teaching Methodology
description: This course explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of Japanese language teaching methodologies, focusing on pedagogical approaches, curriculum design, and classroom management techniques. Students will analyze existing methods, develop their own teaching philosophy, and engage in instructional planning and delivery to prepare them for careers in Japanese language education. Through hands-on experience, students will cultivate their skills in creating effective lesson plans, assessing student learning, and promoting linguistic and cultural competence.

name: English Consecutive Interpreting
description: This course provides students with the skills and techniques necessary to perform consecutive interpreting from English into target languages. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and practical exercises, students will develop the ability to analyze and render spoken English into accurate, idiomatic, and culturally sensitive language, while also honing their knowledge of linguistic, cultural, and contextual factors that impact the interpreting process.

name: English Presentation Skills Teaching in English
description: This course, FL442 English Presentation Skills Teaching in English, equips students with the theoretical foundations and practical skills necessary to effectively teach English presentation skills to diverse learners. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will learn to design, deliver, and assess engaging presentations that promote language acquisition and cultural understanding. By the end of the course, students will be able to develop and teach their own English presentation skills curriculum.

name: Japanese Oral Interpretation
description: In this advanced course, students develop their skills in Japanese oral interpretation, exploring the nuances of spoken language, cultural context, and performance techniques. Through in-depth analysis of Japanese texts and collaborative practice, students will cultivate their ability to convey meaning, evoke emotions, and engage audiences in the target language.

name: Japanese Communication Techniques
description: This intermediate-level course, FL449 Japanese Communication Techniques, delves into the nuances of spoken and written Japanese communication, focusing on the development of effective interpersonal and intercultural skills. Throughout the semester, students will analyze and practice various communication styles, including formal and informal language, nonverbal cues, and cultural norms, to enhance their proficiency in Japanese communication. By the end of the course, students will be able to express themselves confidently and accurately in a range of contexts.

name: Japanese Outside ReadingIII
description: In this advanced reading course, students will delve into a variety of authentic Japanese texts, including literary works, essays, and articles, to improve their reading comprehension and critical thinking skills. Through in-depth analysis and discussion, students will explore the nuances of Japanese language and culture, enhancing their ability to engage with complex texts and express their thoughts in writing.

name: Japanese Outside ReadingIV
description: This course delves into advanced and contemporary Japanese literary works, examining themes, styles, and historical contexts through in-depth analyses of selected novels, short stories, and poetry. Students will develop their reading comprehension and critical thinking skills in Japanese, exploring the complexities of Japanese culture and society through its rich literary heritage.

name: English Reading and Writing Teaching in English
description: This course, FL465 English Reading and Writing Teaching in English, examines the principles and methods of teaching English reading and writing in a variety of educational settings. Students will learn how to design and deliver effective lessons, assess student progress, and utilize instructional technology to enhance student engagement and achievement. Through theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will develop the skills necessary to become confident and competent English language teaching professionals.

name: Work-Place Japanese Conversation
description: This course, Work-Place Japanese Conversation (FL469), focuses on developing advanced conversational skills in Japanese, with a specific emphasis on workplace communication and professional settings. Students will learn how to navigate complex social interactions, negotiate, and communicate effectively in a business context, all while improving their language proficiency and cultural understanding. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and role-playing exercises, students will refine their ability to express themselves confidently and accurately in Japanese.

name: Language and Society Teaching in English
description: In FL470 Language and Society Teaching in English, students develop a deep understanding of language teaching principles, cultural awareness, and sociolinguistic concepts to effectively teach English as a foreign language in diverse social contexts. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical pedagogy, students learn to design and implement inclusive, communicative language instruction that acknowledges the complexities of language and culture. This course prepares students to become effective language teachers in international and multicultural settings.

name: Theory and Practice of English for Specific Purposes
description: In this comprehensive course, FL471: Theory and Practice of English for Specific Purposes, students will engage with the theoretical foundations and practical applications of English language instruction for specialized domains, including business, academia, and the professions. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and project-based learning, students will develop expertise in designing and teaching ESP curricula, materials, and assessments, as well as analyzing the linguistic and cultural needs of diverse learners.

name: Introduction to Learning Chinese as a Foreign Language Teaching in English
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles and practices of teaching Chinese as a foreign language in English-speaking environments. Students will learn the fundamental concepts, methodologies, and techniques for designing and delivering effective language instruction, as well as the cultural and linguistic nuances of teaching Chinese to non-native speakers. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will develop the skills necessary to teach Chinese to a diverse range of learners.

name: Graduation Project I
description: In this capstone course, FL475 Graduation Project I, students engage in the initial stages of designing and developing their graduation projects, applying theoretical knowledge to real-world problems and refining their research methodologies under the guidance of their instructors. Throughout the course, students will learn to articulate their research questions, develop project proposals, and establish a framework for their projects.

name: Graduation Project II
description: En este curso, FL476 Graduación Proyecto II, los estudiantes profundizarán en la elaboración de un proyecto integral que refleje su formación académica y habilidades profesionales adquiridas a lo largo de su carrera. A través de la planificación, realización y evaluación de un proyecto significativo, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades en liderazgo, innovación y resolución de problemas, preparándose para enfrentar desafíos en el campo profesional. A lo largo del curso, se fomentará la reflexión, la autonomía y la evaluación crítica para garantizar un proceso de aprendizaje auténtico y significativo.

name: Research in Applied Linguistics Teaching in English
description: This course, FL502 Research in Applied Linguistics Teaching in English, provides a critical examination of the theoretical frameworks and methodologies underpinning language teaching and learning in English-speaking contexts. Students will develop skills in research design, data collection, and analysis, as well as critically evaluate current trends and debates in applied linguistics.

name: Sociolinguistics Teaching in English
description: This course, FL509 Sociolinguistics Teaching in English, examines the complex relationships between language, culture, and power in English language teaching contexts. Students will learn to analyze and apply sociolinguistic principles to inform their teaching practices, enabling them to address the diverse linguistic needs of their students. Through a critical exploration of language variation, identity, and social context, students will develop the knowledge and skills to create inclusive and effective English language learning environments.

name: Research Methodologies
description: In this comprehensive course (FL511), students will delve into the fundamental principles and techniques of research methodologies, exploring various approaches to qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis. Through a combination of theoretical discussions and practical exercises, students will develop their critical thinking and problem-solving skills, enabling them to design, implement, and evaluate research projects effectively. By the end of the course, students will have a clear understanding of the research process and be equipped to apply their knowledge in a range of academic and professional contexts.

name: Computer-Assisted Language Learning and Computer Literacy Teaching in English
description: This course explores the integration of computer-assisted language learning (CALL) and computer literacy in teaching English as a foreign language. Students will learn to design and implement effective CALL materials, assess language learning outcomes, and develop digital literacy skills to enhance teaching and learning in English language instruction.

name: Japanese Literature and Culture
description: This course delves into the rich cultural and literary heritage of Japan, exploring key works and authors from classical to modern periods. Through in-depth analysis of texts and contextualization of historical and social factors, students will gain a nuanced understanding of the country's literary traditions and their ongoing impact on contemporary Japanese culture.

name: Japanese Children's Literature
description: This course examines the history, themes, and literary devices employed in Japanese children's literature, from traditional folklore to contemporary works. Students will analyze the social, cultural, and historical contexts that shape these texts, developing a nuanced understanding of the genre and its significance in Japanese society. Through close readings and discussions, students will cultivate their critical thinking and analytical skills in the context of Japanese literature.

name: Topics in Japanese Grammar
description: This course, FL536 Topics in Japanese Grammar, delves into the complexities of Japanese sentence structure, exploring various grammatical topics such as clause linkage, modal particles, and case markers. Through in-depth analysis of authentic texts and linguistic data, students will gain a nuanced understanding of Japanese grammatical mechanisms, enabling them to produce accurate and nuanced language. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze and create a range of sentence types, demonstrating a deeper comprehension of Japanese grammatical structures.

name: Quantitative Research Method Teaching in English
description: This course (FL550) provides students with a comprehensive understanding of quantitative research methods, focusing on the application of statistical techniques and data analysis in English. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on exercises, students will learn to design, conduct, and interpret quantitative research studies, developing their analytical and critical thinking skills. Upon completion, students will be equipped to apply research methods in various fields, effectively communicating results in English.

name: Guided Practice in English Research Writing Teaching in English
description: This course, FL557 Guided Practice in English Research Writing and Teaching in English, equips students with the skills and expertise necessary to teach research writing in English academic settings. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and guided pedagogical practice, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of research writing pedagogy and effective instructional strategies to support learner autonomy and academic success.

name: English Writing Teaching in English
description: This course (FL563) explores the principles and practices of teaching English writing to students of varying proficiency levels. Students will develop expertise in designing effective writing instruction, assessing student writing, and creating engaging lesson plans that cater to diverse learning needs. Through a range of pedagogical approaches and case studies, students will gain the knowledge and skills to teach English writing with confidence and creativity.

name: Applications of Online Resources to Teach English Teaching in English
description: This course, FL568, delves into the practical applications of online resources to enhance teaching and learning in English language instruction. Students will learn to effectively utilize digital tools, multimedia materials, and web-based platforms to create engaging lessons, develop virtual classrooms, and foster student-centered learning environments. Through hands-on experience, participants will explore the pedagogical implications of online resources and develop expertise in integrating technology into English language teaching.

name: Computer Applications for Academic Writing in Japanese
description: In this advanced course, FL572: Computer Applications for Academic Writing in Japanese, students will learn to effectively utilize various digital tools and software to enhance their academic writing skills in Japanese. Through hands-on training and case studies, students will develop proficiency in using specialized software for tasks such as grammar checking, plagiarism detection, and citation management, ultimately improving the quality and efficiency of their academic writing.

name: Literature Review in Japanese
description: This course provides a comprehensive analysis of major literary works in Japanese, focusing on key themes, historical contexts, and critical perspectives. Students will engage in close readings of selected texts, develop their analytical skills, and cultivate a deep understanding of the literary traditions and cultural nuances of Japan. Upon completion, students will be able to critically evaluate and synthesize complex literary concepts.

name: Cultural and Creative Industries Teaching in English
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the cultural and creative industries, focusing on effective teaching practices in English language environments. Students will develop expertise in curriculum design, pedagogical strategies, and assessment techniques to enable them to teach cultural and creative subjects with confidence and creativity.

name: Research Methodology Teaching in English
description: In this course, GI503 Research Methodology Teaching in English, students will acquire the essential skills and knowledge to design, implement, and evaluate research methodologies in an English-language academic setting. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will learn to critically analyze research methods, develop effective research designs, and communicate their findings to diverse audiences.

name: Seminar on Research ProjectsII
description: This course, Seminar on Research Projects II, is designed to equip students with advanced skills in research project design, execution, and presentation. Through hands-on experience and peer-to-peer feedback, students will develop their ability to critically evaluate research methodologies, analyze data, and communicate findings effectively in written and oral formats. By the end of the course, students will be well-prepared to initiate and manage research projects independently.

name: Seminar on Research ProjectsI
description: This course provides advanced students with hands-on experience in designing, conducting, and analyzing research projects, refining their skills in critical thinking, data interpretation, and effective communication of research findings. Through a series of case studies and group discussions, students will learn to navigate the research process, address methodological challenges, and present their results in a clear and concise manner.

name: Research of Information Communication Industry Teaching in English
description: This course provides an in-depth examination of the research and development of teaching in the information communication industry, with a focus on the English language. Students will explore the latest trends, methodologies, and best practices in industry-specific teaching, with a strong emphasis on communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Through a range of lectures, discussions, and projects, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the industry and its pedagogical requirements.

name: Electronic Commerce Teaching in English
description: This course, GI622 Electronic Commerce Teaching in English, explores the design and implementation of effective e-commerce teaching strategies in a globalized English-speaking context. Students will learn to develop and deliver online courses, create digital content, and assess learner engagement in electronic commerce education, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and pedagogical best practices. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will cultivate expertise in teaching and learning in the English language.

name: Research of Intellectual Property Teaching in English
description: This course delves into the theoretical and practical aspects of teaching intellectual property (IP) concepts in an English language setting, examining best practices, curriculum design, and assessment strategies for effective instruction. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of IP principles and their pedagogical implications, as well as the skills to design and deliver engaging English-language instruction in IP-related fields.

name: Digital Multimedia Applications Teaching in English
description: This course explores the design, development, and implementation of digital multimedia applications for educational settings. Students will learn to create engaging multimedia content, integrate digital tools into lesson plans, and assess the impact of multimedia on student learning outcomes.

name: Digital Learning and Interface Design
description: In this course, students will delve into the principles and methods of designing effective digital interfaces and learning experiences. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to craft engaging and intuitive digital products that facilitate meaningful learning outcomes.

name: User Experience Research of Digital Media Teaching in English
description: In this graduate-level course, GI644 User Experience Research of Digital Media Teaching in English, students will delve into the theoretical foundations and practical applications of user experience (UX) research methods in the context of digital media teaching. Through a combination of lectures, case studies, and hands-on projects, students will learn to design and conduct UX research to inform instructional design, develop effective digital learning materials, and enhance teaching practices.

name: Marketing Management
description: In this course, GM511 Marketing Management, students will delve into the principles and practices of marketing management, covering the development of marketing strategies, market analysis, product and brand management, as well as marketing channel and pricing decisions. Through case studies and real-world applications, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of marketing management concepts and develop the skills necessary to effectively manage and lead marketing efforts in a global context.

name: Project Management
description: "GM526 Project Management: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of project management principles, methodologies, and best practices, focusing on the Spanish-speaking environment. Students will learn to plan, organize, and execute projects efficiently, developing skills in leadership, risk management, and team collaboration. By the end of the course, students will be able to apply project management techniques to real-world scenarios and make informed decisions in complex project environments."

name: Business Research Method
description: In this course, GM528 Business Research Method, students will delve into the fundamental principles and techniques of business research, acquiring skills to design, conduct, and analyze studies that inform business decisions. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to identify research gaps, develop research questions, and employ various research methods to collect and interpret data.

name: Managerial Accounting
description: In this course, GM588, students will delve into the application of accounting principles in a managerial context, focusing on the use of data to inform business decisions and drive organizational performance. Key topics include budgeting, cost analysis, and performance measurement, with an emphasis on developing skills in financial planning and strategic management. Through a combination of lectures and case studies, students will learn to apply accounting concepts to real-world business scenarios.

name: Organizational Behavior and Leadership
description: "Este curso, GM701 Organización y Liderazgo, explora las interacciones entre individuos, equipos y organizaciones, analizando los comportamientos y estilos de liderazgo efectivos en entornos organizacionales. Los estudiantes aprenderán a evaluar y aplicar diferentes enfoques de liderazgo y comportamiento organizacional para mejorar el desempeño y la eficiencia en ambientes laborales complejos. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes estarán equipados con habilidades prácticas para liderar y desarrollar organizaciones sólidas y exitosas."

name: Strategic Alliance
description: En este curso, los estudiantes analizarán y desarrollarán habilidades para crear y gestionar alianzas estratégicas efectivas, comprendiendo las complejas dinámicas de la colaboración y su impacto en la competitividad empresarial. A través de casos de estudio y actividades prácticas, los estudiantes aprenderán a identificar oportunidades de alianza, desarrollar estrategias de colaboración y gestionar relaciones con socios clave. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes podrán diseñar y implementar alianzas estratégicas que generen valor para las empresas involucradas.

name: Team Building and Management
description: El curso GM733, "Desarrollo y Gestión de Equipos", proporciona a los estudiantes una comprensión profunda de los principios y estrategias necesarios para construir y gestionar equipos efectivos en el trabajo. Al abordar temas clave como la comunicación, la motivación y el liderazgo, los alumnos desarrollarán habilidades esenciales para trabajar en equipo y gestionar con éxito a los miembros del equipo.

name: Management of Technological Innovation
description: This course explores the strategic management of technological innovation, focusing on the development, implementation, and commercialization of new technologies within organizations. Students will analyze the role of innovation in driving business growth, examine the key factors influencing innovation success, and develop the skills necessary to lead and manage innovation initiatives. Through case studies and practical applications, students will learn to integrate technological innovation with organizational strategy.

name: Business Operation & Problem Diagnosis
description: In this interdisciplinary course (GM746), students will delve into the fundamentals of business operations and develop problem diagnosis skills to analyze complex organizational issues. Through a combination of theoretical frameworks and practical case studies, students will learn to identify and mitigate operational problems, optimize business processes, and enhance overall organizational performance. By the end of the course, students will be able to apply analytical and diagnostic tools to drive informed decision-making in a business context.

name: Lectures on Physical and Mental Happiness
description: This undergraduate course, GM748 - Lectures on Physical and Mental Happiness, explores the fundamental principles and theories of happiness from a multidisciplinary perspective. Through in-depth analysis of psychological, philosophical, and sociological concepts, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the factors influencing physical and mental well-being, and learn effective strategies to cultivate lasting happiness.

name: Overseas Studies
description: In this immersive overseas studies program, students will have the opportunity to engage with diverse cultural contexts, develop their language skills, and gain a deeper understanding of global issues and perspectives. Through a combination of coursework, cultural immersion, and experiential learning, students will develop their critical thinking, communication, and problem-solving skills in a foreign language.

name: Motivation and Leadership Studies
description: In this advanced undergraduate course, GM751 Motivation and Leadership Studies, students delve into the complex dynamics of motivation and leadership in organizational settings, examining theoretical frameworks, empirical research, and real-world applications to develop a comprehensive understanding of effective leadership practices. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will analyze the role of motivation in driving individual and team performance, and explore strategies for fostering a productive and motivated work environment.

name: Market Segmentation Planning
description: Este curso aborda a planificação de segmentação de mercado, fornecendo aos alunos uma compreensão profunda dos conceitos e técnicas utilizados para identificar e atender ao mercado-alvo. Os alunos aprenderão a utilizar análises de dados e estratégias de marketing para desenvolver planos de segmentação eficazes e alcançar objetivos de negócios. Ao final do curso, os alunos estarão equipados para aplicar os conceitos da segmentação de mercado em contextos reais de negócios.

name: Efficient Investments and Financial Planning
description: This course explores the principles of efficient investment strategies and financial planning, providing students with a comprehensive understanding of portfolio management, risk assessment, and wealth optimization in the context of Spanish-speaking markets. Through hands-on case studies and real-world applications, students will learn to analyze investment opportunities, develop financial plans, and make informed decisions to achieve their long-term goals. By the end of the course, students will be able to create effective financial plans tailored to individual needs and market conditions.

name: Big Data Analytics for Business Intelligence and Strategic Decisions
description: This course, GM758, explores the application of big data analytics in business intelligence and strategic decision-making. Students will learn to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions to extract insights from complex data sets, driving informed business decisions. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will master the tools and techniques necessary to transform data into actionable business intelligence.

name: Corporate Innovation and Creative Thinking
description: This course explores the principles and practices of corporate innovation, focusing on the development of creative thinking and problem-solving skills essential for driving business growth and success. Students will learn to navigate the complexities of organizational innovation, leveraging design thinking, ideation, and prototyping techniques to generate novel solutions. Through case studies and interactive exercises, students will cultivate a mindset of continuous innovation and entrepreneurship.

name: Corporate Governance and Corporate Sustainability
description: In this course, GM762, students will delve into the complex interplay between corporate governance and corporate sustainability, examining the strategic and regulatory frameworks that shape the decision-making processes of organizations. Through a comprehensive exploration of theoretical concepts and real-world case studies, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the relationships between corporate governance, social responsibility, and economic performance.

name: Business Crisis Management
description: "GM765 Business Crisis Management: Este desenvolvimento deste curso visa fornecer aos alunos conhecimentos e habilidades práticas para gerenciar crises em organizações. Durante o curso, os alunos aprenderão a identificar e mitigar riscos, desenvolver planos de contingência e criar estratégias para lidar com situações de crise."

name: Enterprise Financial Analysis and Decision Making
description: In this course, students will delve into the world of enterprise financial analysis, developing a comprehensive understanding of financial concepts and tools to inform strategic decision making. Through a combination of theoretical and practical applications, students will learn to critically evaluate financial performance, identify areas for improvement, and develop effective financial management strategies.

name: Artificial Intelligent in Enterprise Management
description: In this course, GM768 Artificial Intelligent in Enterprise Management, students will explore the application of artificial intelligence (AI) in organizational settings, focusing on the development of strategic decision-making, process automation, and predictive analytics. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical case studies, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of AI's role in enhancing business operations and competitiveness.

name: New Business Model Research and Practice
description: In this course, GM769, students will delve into the principles and practices of developing innovative business models, exploring new revenue streams, and analyzing the impact of emerging technologies on organizational strategies. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and real-world case studies, students will acquire the skills necessary to design, implement, and evaluate effective business models that drive growth and competitiveness.

name: Sustainable Development: Carbon Neutrality and Carbon Trading
description: This course explores the principles and practices of sustainable development, focusing on strategies for achieving carbon neutrality and the mechanics of carbon trading. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the economic, environmental, and social aspects of carbon management, as well as the role of policy and market mechanisms in promoting low-carbon transitions. Through case studies and real-world examples, students will develop skills to analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of carbon neutrality and carbon trading initiatives.

name: Talent Density and Team Competitiveness
description: "GM775 Talent Density and Team Competitiveness: This course explores the relationship between individual talent and team performance, examining the strategic implications of talent density and its impact on organizational competitiveness. Students will learn to analyze and develop effective strategies for leveraging talent to drive team success and achieve business objectives, with a focus on real-world applications and case studies."

name: Mathematics and Logic Thinking
description: In this undergraduate course, GN201 Mathematics and Logic Thinking, students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills through the application of mathematical and logical concepts to real-world scenarios. By combining theoretical foundations in mathematics and logic with practical problem-solving exercises, students will enhance their analytical reasoning and decision-making abilities.

name: Introduction to Medical Engineering
description: In this foundational course, students delve into the principles and applications of medical engineering, exploring the integration of engineering and medical sciences to develop innovative healthcare solutions. Throughout the semester, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of medical devices, imaging techniques, and biomaterials, as well as the regulatory frameworks governing their development and deployment.

name: Appreciation of Landscape
description: In this course, GN225, students will delve into the theoretical and practical aspects of landscape appreciation, exploring the cultural, historical, and environmental contexts that shape our understanding of the natural and built environment. Through a mix of lectures, discussions, and field excursions, students will develop their critical thinking and observation skills to analyze and interpret the complexities of landscape design and aesthetics. By the end of the course, students will be able to articulate a nuanced understanding of landscape as a multifaceted and dynamic concept.

name: Camera World
description: Este curso, Camera World (GN237), explora las complejidades del lenguaje visual en la fotografía y el cine. Los estudiantes desarrollan habilidades técnicas y analíticas para comprender y crear imágenes que narran historias y comunican ideas. A lo largo del curso, los estudiantes se sumergen en la teoría y la práctica de la fotografía y el cine para crear un lenguaje visual sólido.

name: Introduction to Energy Technology
description: In this course, GN247 "Einführung in die Energie-Technologie" (Introduction to Energy Technology), students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the fundamental principles and technologies involved in the production, transmission, and consumption of energy. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical examples, students will learn about the various energy sources, energy conversion technologies, and the role of energy in shaping our modern world. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically evaluate the benefits and limitations of different energy technologies.

name: History of Science Teaching in English
description: This course, GN407 History of Science Teaching in English, explores the historical development and evolution of science education in the English language, examining key milestones, pedagogical innovations, and cultural influences that have shaped the discipline. Through a critical examination of historical and contemporary practices, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complexities and contingencies of science teaching, enabling them to design and deliver effective science education programs. Upon completion, students will be equipped to critically analyze and contextualize the teaching and learning of science within diverse cultural and linguistic contexts.

name: Nature Inspired Design Teaching in English
description: In this interdisciplinary course, GN409: Nature Inspired Design Teaching in English, students will explore the principles and methods of incorporating natural systems and biomimicry into design practice, with a focus on effective teaching strategies to convey these concepts to English-speaking students. Through a combination of theoretical foundations, case studies, and hands-on activities, students will develop a deeper understanding of nature-inspired design principles and learn how to communicate them effectively in a teaching context.

name: Introduction to Cosmetics and Its Application
description: This course provides an in-depth examination of the principles and practices in the field of cosmetics, covering topics such as skincare, haircare, and color cosmetics. Students will gain knowledge on formulation, product development, and application techniques, as well as the regulatory frameworks governing the cosmetics industry. Upon completion of this course, students will be able to analyze and apply cosmetic product development principles in a practical setting.

name: Travel in Taiwan with Geosciences
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of Taiwan's diverse geospatial environment through a combination of lectures, field excursions, and cultural experiences. Students will examine the geological, geomorphic, and hydrological processes that have shaped the island's landscape, as well as the human impacts on these environments. By integrating geospatial perspectives with cultural and historical contexts, students will gain a nuanced understanding of Taiwan's complex spatial relationships.

name: Discovering the Earth's Atmosphere
description: En este curso, los estudiantes explorarán la estructura, dinámica y componentes químicos y físicos del atmósfera terrestre. A través de discusiones teóricas, análisis de datos y casos de estudio, los estudiantes adquirirán conocimientos profundos sobre los procesos atmosféricos y su impacto en el medio ambiente, la sociedad y la economía. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes tendrán una comprensión sólida de la atmósfera y podrán analizar sus procesos y cambios en contextos locales y globales.

name: The Past and the Future of the Digital Technologies 科技與社會微學程 數位與創新永續微學程
description: This course, "The Past and the Future of the Digital Technologies 科技與社會微學程 數位與創新永續微學程", explores the historical development and potential future directions of digital technologies in Taiwan, examining their impact on society, economy, and culture. Through lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will gain a deeper understanding of the complex relationships between technology, innovation, and sustainability. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically analyze the role of digital technologies in shaping Taiwan's social and economic landscape.

name: Fundamental Cloud Computing and Practic
description: Esta curso, GN430, introduce a los estudiantes a los fundamentos del computación en la nube, cubriendo conceptos básicos, arquitecturas y tecnologías clave. Los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar, implementar y administrar aplicaciones y sistemas en entornos de computación en la nube, así como a evaluar las ventajas y desventajas de las diferentes plataformas y servicios. A través de prácticas y proyectos, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades prácticas para trabajar en entornos de computación en la nube.

name: Figures and Chinese History
description: In this course, students delve into the significance of key figures in shaping China's rich and complex historical landscape, exploring their roles, contributions, and lasting impacts on the country's development. Through a critical examination of historical documents, literature, and cultural artifacts, students gain a nuanced understanding of the individuals who have influenced China's history, politics, and society.

name: The History of Chinese Art
description: This course provides a comprehensive exploration of the historical development of Chinese art from its ancient roots to the present day, examining key themes, styles, and cultural influences that have shaped the country's rich artistic heritage. Students will analyze the evolution of Chinese art across various mediums, including painting, calligraphy, ceramics, and sculpture, and gain a deeper understanding of the social, cultural, and historical contexts in which they were created. Through a range of visual and textual materials, students will develop a nuanced appreciation for the complexities and diversities of Chinese art.

name: Social Psychology
description: In diesem Kurs werden Studierende die Grundlagen der sozialen Psychologie kennenlernen, darunter die Einflüsse des sozialen Umfelds auf menschliches Verhalten, die Rolle von Gruppen und Identität sowie die Faktoren, die menschliche Entscheidungen und Einstellungen beeinflussen. Durch die Analyse von sozialpsychologischen Theorien und Forschungsergebnissen werden Studierende ihre kritische Denkfähigkeit und ihre Fähigkeit zur Anwendung sozialpsychologischer Konzepte verbessern.

name: Introduction to the Study of Law
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental principles and concepts of law, exploring the theoretical framework and historical development of the legal system. Students will examine the relationship between law and society, the role of institutions and legal professionals, and the various branches of law, including civil, criminal, and constitutional law. Through a critical analysis of case studies and legal texts, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complexities of the law.

name: Introduction to Psychology
description: This course, GS349: Introduction to Psychology, is a foundational exploration of the discipline, examining the biological, cognitive, and social factors that shape human behavior and mental processes. Through a comprehensive examination of key theories, research methods, and empirical findings, students will gain a deeper understanding of the psychological principles that underlie human experience.

name: Marriages & Families
description: This interdisciplinary course, GS357: Marriages & Families, examines the complex dynamics of family relationships and structures within diverse cultural contexts. Through a critical analysis of sociological, psychological, and anthropological perspectives, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the various forms and functions of marriage and family systems, as well as the challenges and opportunities that arise within them.

name: Intellectual Property Rights 文化產業微學程 文化產業學程（學士班） 科技創業與管理微學程
description: This course (GS372) delves into the intricacies of intellectual property rights, exploring their impact on the cultural industry in Taiwan. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of Taiwan's intellectual property laws and regulations, enabling them to navigate the complexities of creative work and business management in this field.

name: Assiduity about Society 社會關懷與創意知能微學程
description: This interdisciplinary course, GS375 社會關懷與創意知能微學程, delves into the complexities of societal issues, encouraging students to critically evaluate and develop innovative solutions. Through a Taiwanese context, students will explore the intersections of social welfare, community engagement, and creative problem-solving, fostering empathetic and effective approaches to social challenges.

name: Global Cities and Social Space Teaching in English
description: In this interdisciplinary course, GS396: Global Cities and Social Space, students explore the complex relationships between urbanization, social inequality, and cultural expression in global cities. Through a critical examination of theoretical frameworks and case studies, students develop a nuanced understanding of the ways in which urban environments shape social identities, inequalities, and power dynamics.

name: Self Management and Career Development
description: In this interdisciplinary course, GS418: Self Management and Career Development, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the skills and strategies required for effective self-management and career advancement. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to develop a personalized approach to goal-setting, time management, and professional networking, ultimately enhancing their employability and career prospects.

name: Technology Development and Society Change
description: In "Technology Development and Society Change" (GS425), students explore the complex relationships between technological advancements and societal transformations. Through a critical examination of historical and contemporary case studies, students analyze the social, economic, and cultural impacts of technological innovations on individuals and communities, and develop a nuanced understanding of the reciprocal influences between technology and society.

name: Gender Education
description: This course, GS426 "Gender Education," explores the complexities of gender and its role in shaping our understanding of identity, culture, and society. Through a critical examination of theoretical perspectives and empirical research, students will develop a nuanced understanding of gender dynamics, power relations, and their impact on individuals and communities.

name: Media and International Relations
description: In this course, GS430 Media and International Relations, students will explore the complex interplay between media, politics, and global relations, examining how the media shapes international discourse and influences global decision-making processes. Through a critical analysis of case studies and theoretical frameworks, students will gain a deeper understanding of the ways in which media can both reflect and construct international relations.

name: A brief introduction to European History Teaching in English
description: This course provides an introduction to the history of European education, tracing the development of educational systems and philosophies from the Enlightenment to the present day. Students will explore key milestones, influential thinkers, and pedagogical innovations that have shaped the English language teaching landscape in Europe. Through a comparative analysis of historical and contemporary perspectives, students will gain a nuanced understanding of European educational traditions and their global implications.

name: Labor Protection & Rights
description: This course examines the legal frameworks and practices surrounding labor protection and rights in a national and international context. Students will analyze the historical development of labor laws, explore the role of government and trade unions, and evaluate the impact of globalization on labor rights. Through case studies and discussions, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complexities surrounding labor protection.

name: Digital Media Literacy, Thinking, and Practice
description: In this interdisciplinary course (GS448), students will explore the critical thinking and creative skills required to navigate and produce digital media in a global context. Through a combination of theoretical frameworks, case studies, and practical exercises, students will develop their abilities to critically evaluate, produce, and communicate effectively in a digital age.

name: Childhood And Culture
description: "Exploring the intricate relationships between childhood and culture, this course delves into the dynamic interplay of social, historical, and cultural contexts that shape the experiences of children and young people. Through a critical examination of theoretical perspectives and case studies, students will develop a deeper understanding of the complex ways in which culture influences childhood and vice versa. By the end of this course, students will be able to critically analyze and interpret the cultural construction of childhood and its implications for social policy and practice."

name: Digital Applications in Humanities I
description: This course introduces students to the theoretical and practical applications of digital tools and methods in the humanities. Students will explore various digital media, including text analysis software, geographic information systems, and digital editing tools, and learn to critically evaluate their use in humanities research. Through case studies and hands-on exercises, students will develop skills to create and analyze digital projects in the humanities.

name: Digital Applications in Humanities II
description: In this advanced course, students will delve into the theoretical and practical aspects of digital tools and methodologies in the humanities, exploring their applications in fields such as cultural heritage preservation, literary analysis, and historical research. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will develop expertise in digital scholarship, including data analysis, visualization, and digital curation.

name: Fundamental of Digital Makers 科技創業與管理微學程 科技與社會微學程 數位與創新永續微學程
description: This course explores the foundational principles and practices of digital makers, incorporating elements of technology entrepreneurship, social responsibility, and sustainable innovation. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and hands-on experience, students will learn to design, develop, and implement innovative digital solutions that address real-world challenges. By the end of the course, students will be able to apply creative problem-solving skills and critically evaluate the social and environmental implications of their digital creations.

name: Advenced of Digital Makers
description: En esta asignatura, los estudiantes explorarán las últimas tendencias y aplicaciones de la creación digital, incluyendo el diseño asistido por computadora, la impresión 3D y la realidad aumentada. A través de proyectos prácticos y casos de estudio, analizarán las posibilidades creativas y tecnológicas de los makers y desarrollarán sus habilidades en el uso de herramientas digitales para crear soluciones innovadoras. Al finalizar la asignatura, los estudiantes estarán capacitados para abordar desafíos creativos y tecnológicos en un contexto profesional.

name: Photography
description: "Cours IC116 Photographe: Dans ce cours, les étudiants s'initieront aux principes fondamentaux de la photographie, en abordant les techniques de composition, d'éclairage et de traitement d'image. Ils auront l'occasion d'expérimenter et de développer leurs compétences créatives à travers des projets photographiques individuels et en groupe, permettant ainsi une compréhension approfondie de l'art et de la technique de la photographie."

name: Digital Image Processing Teaching in English
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and techniques of digital image processing, covering topics such as image enhancement, restoration, and compression, as well as segmentation and feature extraction. Students will learn to apply theoretical concepts using industry-standard software and tools, and develop skills in analyzing and interpreting digital image data. Upon completion, students will be able to design and implement image processing solutions for a variety of applications.

name: Fundamentals of ArtsI: Drawing
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental skills and techniques of drawing, exploring various mediums and styles to develop an understanding of visual representation and expression. Students will learn to observe, analyze, and render forms, shapes, and proportions, as well as experiment with different drawing methods and tools. Through practical exercises and projects, students will cultivate their creative expression and develop a solid foundation in the fundamentals of drawing.

name: Introduction to Design Principles Teaching in English
description: In this foundational course, students will explore the fundamental principles of design, including balance, contrast, emphasis, movement, pattern, unity, and white space, and apply these principles to create visually effective solutions. Through lectures, discussions, and creative projects, students will develop an understanding of the design process and cultivate their critical thinking and problem-solving skills. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze and create effective designs that communicate ideas and engage audiences.

name: Fundamentals of ArtsII: Creative Drawing
description: In this intermediate-level course, students will delve into the principles and techniques of creative drawing, exploring various mediums and styles to develop their artistic expression and visual communication skills. Through hands-on exercises and projects, students will refine their understanding of line, shape, value, texture, and space, culminating in the creation of a comprehensive portfolio.

name: Data Structure
description: "Esta lección introduce a los estudiantes a las estructuras de datos fundamentales, abarcando temas como arreglos, listas enlazadas, pilas y colas, árboles binarios y algoritmos de ordenamiento, buscados y manipulación de datos. A través de casos de estudio y aplicaciones prácticas, los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar, implementar y evaluar soluciones eficientes para problemas complejos de gestión de datos. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes estarán capacitados para analizar y resolver problemas de estructuras de datos en contextos de desarrollo de sistemas y ciencias de la computación."

name: Design History
description: This course, "Design History" (IC175), explores the evolution of design principles and their cultural, social, and historical contexts. Through lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will analyze the development of design movements and trends, and learn to critically evaluate the impact of design on society.

name: Introduction to Computer Science Teaching in English
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles and practices of teaching computer science in English, equipping students with the knowledge and skills to effectively communicate technical concepts to diverse learners. Students will develop a deep understanding of computer science education, instructional design, and language support strategies, enabling them to create engaging and inclusive learning environments.

name: Computer ProgrammingI
description: "IC184 Computer ProgrammingI is an introductory course that teaches fundamental programming concepts and skills using a chosen programming language in the language of instruction (Spanish). Students will learn to design, write, test, and debug programs, as well as develop problem-solving skills and understand software development principles. Through hands-on programming exercises and projects, students will develop a solid foundation in computer programming."

name: Mixed Media Design
description: Dans ce cours d'intégration de la conception de médias mixtes (IC189), les étudiants découvriront les principes et les outils fondamentaux pour créer des projets visuels complexes à l'aide de différentes techniques, telles que la peinture, la photographie, la sculpture et l'illustration numérique. Ils apprendront à composer et à assemblage différents éléments de médias pour produire des œuvres d'art innovantes et interactives, tout en explorant les thématiques de l'expression visuelle, de la créativité et de la communication.

name: Color Theory
description: Cette cours d'IC191, théorie des couleurs, explore les principes fondamentaux de la couleur et de son application dans l'art et la conception. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie des modèles de couleurs, des harmonies chromatiques et des effets de lumière, permettant ainsi de développer leurs compétences en matière de création et de composition visuelle.

name: Computer ProgrammingII
description: Esta segunda parte del curso de programación aborda conceptos avanzados de lenguaje de programación, incluyendo algoritmos, estructuras de datos y técnicas de programación orientada a objetos. Los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar y desarrollar soluciones complejas utilizando lenguajes de programación como Java, C++ y Python, y aplicarán sus habilidades para resolver problemas en diversas áreas de la informática.

name: Principles of Animation
description: Cette formation, IC194 Principes d'animation, présente les fondements théoriques et pratiques de l'animation, permettant aux étudiants de comprendre les principes clés de la narration visuelle, la composition des images et la dynamique du mouvement. Au travers d'exercices pratiques et de projets, les élèves apprendront à maîtriser les techniques essentielles de l'animation, du storyboard à la production de séquences animées. Cette formation est conçue pour développer les compétences créatives et techniques nécessaires pour créer des contenus visuels engageants.

name: Mixed Reality 互動媒體學程 含微學程
description: This course, Mixed Reality 互動媒體學程 含微學程 (IC196), delves into the principles and applications of immersive mixed reality experiences, encompassing both virtual and augmented reality environments. Students will gain hands-on experience in designing, developing, and implementing interactive multimedia projects that integrate physical and digital elements. Through this course, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of mixed reality technologies and their potential applications in various fields.

name: Computer Programming Lab.II
description: This course is a continuation of IC100, with a focus on advanced programming concepts, data structures, and software development methodologies. Students will learn to design, implement, and test complex algorithms and programs, as well as work in a collaborative environment to develop software solutions. Through hands-on lab exercises and assignments, students will develop proficiency in programming and problem-solving skills.

name: Computer Graphics Design
description: IC205 Computer Graphics Design: Este curso aborda as principais técnicas e ferramentas utilizadas na criação de gráficos computacionais, desde conceitos básicos até projetos mais avançados. Alunos aprenderão a projetar e implementar modelos tridimensionais, texturas e iluminação, além de explorar os recursos de edição e animação de gráficos.

name: Computer Programming
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of computer programming, covering syntax, data types, control structures, functions, and object-oriented programming. Through hands-on exercises and projects, students will learn to design, develop, and implement algorithms, as well as apply programming principles to solve real-world problems. By the end of the course, students will be able to write efficient and effective programs in a chosen programming language.

name: General Physics
description: In this undergraduate course, IC224: General Physics, students will delve into the fundamental principles of physics, encompassing mechanics, thermodynamics, electromagnetism, and wave phenomena. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and problem-solving activities, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of physical concepts and mathematical models, preparing them for advanced studies in science and engineering. The course is conducted entirely in the native language.

name: Interactive Script Production
description: This course, IC225 Interactive Script Production, explores the art of crafting compelling narratives for interactive media, including video games, virtual reality, and immersive experiences. Students will learn to develop engaging storylines, characters, and dialogue, as well as to integrate interactive elements that drive the narrative forward. Through hands-on exercises and project-based learning, students will produce interactive scripts that bring stories to life in innovative and immersive ways.

name: Windows Programming
description: This course, IC238 Windows Programming, introduces students to the fundamentals of Windows-based application development using C# and the .NET framework. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical exercises, students will learn to design, implement, and deploy graphical user interfaces, databases, and other key features essential for modern Windows applications.

name: Game Planning
description: IC242 Game Planning: Within this course, students will explore the key aspects of game development, including game design, user experience, and project management. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical exercises, students will learn to create comprehensive game plans that balance creative vision with technical feasibility.

name: Linear Algebra
description: In questa lezione introduttiva di Algebra Lineare, gli studenti svilupperanno una comprensione solida delle strutture fondamentali della linearità, comprese matrici, spazi vettoriali, trasformazioni lineari e sistemi di equazioni lineari. Attraverso un approccio pratico e teorico, gli studenti apprenderanno a risolvere problemi complessi utilizzando tecniche di algebra lineare, sviluppando competenze analitiche e risolutive fondamentali.

name: Case Study on Cultural Industries
description: In this course, IC249 Case Study on Cultural Industries, students will delve into the complex dynamics of cultural industries through a critical analysis of case studies from various sectors, including film, music, and art. By examining the social, economic, and political factors that shape these industries, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the cultural and creative processes that underpin them.

name: Creativity Techniques 互動媒體學程 含微學程
description: This course, IC256 Creativity Techniques 互動媒體學程 含微學程, focuses on developing students' creative problem-solving skills and media literacy through hands-on experiences and practical exercises in interactive media production. Students will learn to apply various techniques to generate innovative ideas, design engaging multimedia content, and effectively communicate with diverse audiences. Throughout the course, students will cultivate their critical thinking and creativity in a collaborative learning environment.

name: Illustration
description: In this foundational course, IC272 Illustration, students will explore the fundamental principles and techniques of visual storytelling through a variety of mediums and styles. Students will develop their creative skills in drawing, composition, and color theory, while understanding the cultural and historical contexts that shape the art of illustration. Through practical exercises and projects, students will cultivate their unique artistic voice and style.

name: Java Programming
description: In this course, IC275 Java Programming, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of Java programming fundamentals, including object-oriented design principles, data structures, and software development methodologies. Through hands-on exercises and projects, students will develop skills in Java programming languages and apply them to real-world scenarios. By the end of the course, students will be able to design, implement, and test Java-based software applications.

name: Computer Programming Lab.I
description: This introductory lab course provides hands-on experience in computer programming through practical exercises and projects, covering fundamental programming concepts, data structures, and algorithms in a programming language specified by the department. Students will develop problem-solving skills, learn to design, implement, and test software solutions, and apply programming principles to real-world problems.

name: Introduction to Calculus
description: La introducción al Cálculo (IC287): esta asignatura presenta los fundamentos de las teorías de límites, derivadas y integrales, proporcionando un conocimiento sólido de los conceptos y habilidades matemáticas necesarias para la comprensión y resolución de problemas en campos como la física, ingeniería y economía. A través de ejercicios y problemas prácticos, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades analíticas y resolutorias para aplicar el cálculo en diferentes contextos. Al final de la asignatura, los estudiantes habrán adquirido una sólida base para abordar temas avanzados en matemáticas.

name: Designing Wearable Technology I Teaching in English
description: In this introductory course, students will explore the design principles and methodologies for creating wearable technology products that seamlessly integrate form and function. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on projects, students will learn to conceptualize, prototype, and evaluate wearable technology solutions that enhance user experience and promote innovation.

name: Creative Media Practice
description: In diesem Kurs entwickeln Studenten ihre kreativen Fähigkeiten in der Medienproduktion. Durch die Arbeit in verschiedenen Medien wie Film, Theater, Musik und Bildende Kunst, erwerben sie ein tiefes Verständnis für die Theorien und Praktiken der Medienkunst. Durch die praktische Anwendung und Reflexion der eigenen kreativen Prozesse, werden Studenten in der Lage sein, innovative Medienprodukte zu entwickeln und zu realisieren.

name: Exhibition Display Technology Teaching in English 互動多媒體微學程 互動多媒體學程 互動媒體學程 含微學程
description: In this course, IC297: Exhibition Display Technology Teaching in English, students will learn the fundamentals of interactive multimedia design and exhibition display technology, with a focus on teaching and implementation in a professional setting. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will develop the skills to design, create, and evaluate interactive multimedia displays, with a strong emphasis on cultural sensitivity and language considerations.

name: Advanced Film and Video Production Workshop
description: In this advanced workshop, students delve into the technical and creative aspects of film and video production, refining their skills in scriptwriting, cinematography, editing, and post-production techniques. Through hands-on projects and collaborative exercises, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the filmmaking process, exploring narrative storytelling, visual aesthetics, and industry-standard software.

name: Cross-Media Integration
description: In this Spanish-language course, IC324: Integración de Medios, students will explore the theoretical foundations and practical applications of cross-media integration in the context of modern communication. Through case studies, workshops, and group projects, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of how to create cohesive and engaging experiences across multiple platforms, incorporating principles of branding, storytelling, and audience analysis. By the end of the course, students will be able to design and implement effective cross-media campaigns that maximize reach and impact.

name: Portfolio Design and Presentation
description: In this course (IC326), students learn the principles and techniques of portfolio design and presentation, focusing on effective visual communication and creative expression. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical exercises, students develop their skills in selecting, organizing, and presenting their work to achieve a compelling and cohesive portfolio.

name: Analysis for Social Media Services
description: "Este curso introduce a los estudiantes a la análisis de los servicios de redes sociales, cubriendo temas como la recopilación y análisis de datos, la medición de la eficacia de las plataformas y la creación de informes y recomendaciones de estrategia. Los estudiantes aprenderán a evaluar las métricas clave para la gestión de contenido, la influencia y la participación en las redes sociales, y aplicar técnicas de análisis para mejorar la eficacia de las campañas de marketing. name: Computer Programming Lab.
description: In this hands-on laboratory course, students will gain practical experience in computer programming through the development of real-world applications using relevant programming languages. Students will learn to design, implement, and test software solutions, applying theoretical concepts learned in accompanying lectures to develop problem-solving skills and programming proficiency.

name: 3D Computer Animation
description: Cette cours IC337, Animation 3D, explore les principes et les techniques de base de l'animation 3D, permettant aux étudiants de créer des modèles 3D, des animations et des effets visuels sophistiqués. Les étudiants auront l'occasion d'apprendre à maîtriser les logiciels de modélisation 3D et de rendu, ainsi que les concepts de animation et d'effets spéciaux.

name: Fundamental of Data Structures
description: Introduces to the fundamental concepts and techniques of data structures, covering arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Students will learn how to design, implement, and analyze algorithms to solve complex problems, as well as understand the time and space complexities of various data structures.

name: Discrete Mathematics
