description: "IM216 Discrete Mathematics: Este curso cubre los fundamentos de matemáticas discretas, incluyendo teoria de conjuntos, relaciones y funciones, álgebras booleanas, recurrencias y grafos. Los estudiantes aprenderán a aplicar estos conceptos para resolver problemas complejos y mejorar sus habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas. A través de ejercicios y proyectos, los estudiantes desarrollarán sus habilidades para razonar matemáticamente."

name: Introduction to Multimedia
description: In this course, IM230 Introduction to Multimedia, students gain a comprehensive understanding of the fundamental principles and techniques involved in creating multimedia content. Through lectures, practical exercises, and project-based learning, students will develop skills in multimedia production, including video editing, graphic design, and audio production, with a focus on storytelling and effective communication.

name: StatisticsⅠ
description: This course introduces fundamental concepts and methods of statistics, covering data description, probability theory, and statistical inference. Students will learn to analyze and interpret data, calculate descriptive statistics, and apply hypothesis testing and confidence intervals. By the end of the course, students will possess a solid understanding of statistical principles and be able to apply them in real-world settings.

name: Introduction to Data Analytics 「社會數據分析」跨領域微學程 數據分析微學程
description: This course, "Introduction to Data Analytics", provides students with a comprehensive introduction to data analysis concepts and techniques, enabling them to extract insights from complex data sets and make informed decisions. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and hands-on practice, students will learn to collect, clean, and visualize data, as well as apply statistical methods and data mining techniques to address real-world problems.

name: Digital Marketing in Practice 電子化企業學程
description: This course, "電子化企業學程" (Digital Marketing in Practice), explores the practical applications of digital marketing strategies and tactics in a Taiwanese business context. Students will learn how to develop and implement effective digital marketing campaigns, analyze consumer behavior, and measure campaign success in a rapidly changing digital landscape. Through case studies and hands-on projects, students will gain a deep understanding of digital marketing principles and best practices.

name: Introduction to Business Management 電子化企業學程
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts and principles of business management, covering topics such as organizational behavior, human resources management, marketing, and financial management. Through lectures and discussions, students will learn how to analyze business operations, develop strategic plans, and make informed decisions in a dynamic business environment. By the end of the course, students will have a solid understanding of the core functions of business management and be able to apply theoretical concepts to real-world business scenarios.

name: Computer Networks 資訊安全微學程
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and technologies of computer networks, with a focus on 資訊安全 (information security). Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will gain a deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and security measures to protect against various threats and vulnerabilities in modern computer networks.

name: Introduction to Information Security Management 資訊安全微學程
description: This course (IM334) provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles and practices of information security management, covering topics such as risk assessment, threat analysis, data protection, and incident response. Students will gain a solid understanding of the key concepts and strategies in managing information security, including security policies, compliance, and governance. Upon completion, students will be able to design and implement effective information security measures to protect organizational assets.

name: Information and Law 電子化供應鏈
description: 本課程「電子化供應鏈」(IM409) 介紹了信息技術在現代供應鏈管理中的應用，涵蓋供應鏈信息化系統、電子商務、供應鏈安全性等主題。課程中，學生將學習供應鏈信息化的理論基礎、實踐案例和最新趨勢。

name: SeminarI
description: "In this advanced seminar, students delve into in-depth analysis of theoretical concepts and real-world applications in their chosen field of study. Through a combination of lectures, case studies, and group discussions, students develop their critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills. By the end of the course, students are expected to demonstrate a sophisticated understanding of the subject matter and its relevance to contemporary issues."

name: Intelligent Management Systems
description: In this course, IM504 Intelligent Management Systems, students will explore the fundamental principles and applications of intelligent management systems, including data-driven decision making, artificial intelligence, and predictive analytics. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical case studies, students will develop the skills to design, implement, and evaluate effective intelligent management systems. By the end of the course, students will be able to apply intelligent management systems to solve real-world problems and improve organizational performance.

name: Decision Support Systems Teaching in English
description: This course introduces students to the development and implementation of decision support systems (DSS) as a key technology in facilitating informed decision-making. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will learn to design, develop, and evaluate DSS models that integrate business intelligence, data analytics, and optimization techniques. By the end of the course, students will be able to apply DSS principles to real-world problems and develop effective decision support solutions.

name: SeminarII
description: In diesem Seminar II werden die Grundlagen der Forschungsmethodik vertieft und die Fähigkeit, wissenschaftliche Fragestellungen zu bearbeiten, entwickelt. Studierende lernen, komplexe Probleme zu analysieren, wissenschaftliche Literatur zu bewerten und eigene Forschungsprojekte zu planen und durchzuführen. Durch diese Kompetenzen werden die Studierenden in der Lage sein, ihre Forschungsergebnisse auf einer wissenschaftlichen Konferenz zu präsentieren.

name: Business Research Method
description: This course provides students with an in-depth understanding of business research methods, enabling them to design, conduct, and analyze research studies in a business context. Students will learn to critically evaluate research methodologies, collect and analyze data, and draw meaningful conclusions to inform business decisions. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will develop skills to navigate complex research challenges in business settings.

name: Problem Solving and Decision Making Teaching in English
description: This course, IM531 Problem Solving and Decision Making Teaching in English, equips students with essential skills and strategies to effectively teach problem-solving and decision-making to English-speaking learners. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will gain a deep understanding of how to facilitate critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills in diverse educational settings. By the end of the course, students will be able to design and implement engaging lesson plans that foster effective problem-solving and decision-making competencies in their students.

name: Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
description: In this course, IM532: Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining, students will delve into the fundamental concepts, techniques, and tools of data mining, including data preprocessing, pattern discovery, and knowledge representation. Through a combination of lectures, case studies, and hands-on exercises, students will learn to extract valuable insights from large datasets and apply data mining techniques to real-world problems. By the end of the course, students will be able to design and implement effective data mining solutions using industry-standard software and tools.

name: Fuzzy Systems Theory and Applications
description: In this course, students will delve into the theoretical foundations and practical applications of fuzzy systems, exploring the mathematical frameworks, algorithms, and methodologies that underpin this complex field. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on projects, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of fuzzy set theory, fuzzy logic, and their implementations in control systems, decision-making, and pattern recognition.

name: Seminar on Information Technology Management Teaching in English
description: In this advanced seminar, students will delve into the principles and best practices of teaching Information Technology Management (ITM) in an English-language setting. Through interactive discussions, case studies, and peer feedback, students will develop their expertise in crafting engaging ITM curricula, assessing student learning outcomes, and leveraging innovative teaching methods to enhance student success.

name: E-Business Management
description: In this course, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the strategic and operational aspects of e-business, including its management, marketing, and technology. They will learn to analyze the impact of digital transformation on business models, develop e-business strategies, and implement effective digital marketing and e-commerce solutions. Through case studies and practical exercises, students will develop skills in e-business management and be equipped to navigate the challenges of the digital economy.

name: Special Topics in e-Business
description: In this advanced course, IM574 Special Topics in e-Business, students delve into the latest trends and strategies in e-commerce, exploring the intersection of technology, business models, and digital marketing. Through case studies and interactive discussions, students develop a comprehensive understanding of the complex dynamics driving the digital economy and learn to design innovative e-business solutions.

name: Information Management Theory and Practice Teaching in English
description: This course, IM591 Information Management Theory and Practice, provides students with a comprehensive understanding of information management principles and practices through both theoretical and practical applications. Students will develop analytical and problem-solving skills to address the complexities of information management in various organizational settings. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to design, implement, and evaluate information management systems that meet organizational needs.

name: Business Administration Theory and Practice Teaching in English
description: This course provides an in-depth examination of business administration theories and practices, focusing on their application in real-world settings. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of business principles and learn effective teaching methods to convey complex concepts in an accessible manner, all delivered in English. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will cultivate the skills necessary to excel in business education.

name: Quantitative Method Decision Making
description: "IM593 Quantitative Method Decision Making: Este curso se centra en la aplicación de técnicas cuantitativas para apoyar la toma de decisiones en los negocios. Los estudiantes aprenderán a utilizar herramientas estadísticas y análisis de datos para evaluar opciones, identificar patrones y desarrollar estrategias informadas. A través de casos y proyectos, los estudiantes aplicarán conceptos a situaciones reales para mejorar su capacidad de tomar decisiones informadas."

name: Vocational Training
description: This course, IM595 Vocational Training, is designed to equip students with practical skills and knowledge in a specific trade or industry. Through hands-on training and guided instruction, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of vocational techniques and methodologies, enabling them to excel in their chosen profession. Upon completion, students will be proficient in applying theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios.

name: SeminarIV
description: In this advanced seminar, students delve into the theoretical foundations and practical applications of [insert field of study], exploring complex concepts and methodologies through a combination of lectures, discussions, and group projects. Through a critical examination of case studies and contemporary issues, students develop nuanced understanding and analytical skills to tackle real-world problems.

name: Applied ProjectII
description: In "Applied Project II" (IM608), students develop advanced project management skills to successfully lead and execute complex business initiatives. Through applied learning, participants design, implement, and evaluate comprehensive projects that integrate technical, financial, and organizational components. By the end of the course, students will possess the expertise to manage projects in various industries, leveraging their analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.

name: Information Security
description: Este curso de Seguridad de la Información (IM620) brinda una exploración integral de los principios y prácticas de seguridad de la información, equipando a los estudiantes con las habilidades y conocimientos necesarios para proteger y gestionar la seguridad de sistemas informáticos, redes y datos en un entorno empresarial. A través de una serie de sesiones teóricas y prácticas, los estudiantes aprenderán a identificar y mitigar riesgos de seguridad, implementar medidas de protección y responder a incidentes de seguridad. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes serán capaces de analizar y resolver problemas de seguridad de la información de manera efectiva.

name: Applied Project
description: In this practical, project-based course (IM628), students will apply theoretical concepts to real-world scenarios, developing problem-solving skills and expertise in project management, analysis, and implementation. Through hands-on experience, students will learn to design, execute, and evaluate projects, fostering collaboration, leadership, and time management skills.

name: Introduction to Data Science
description: In this course, IM701, students will delve into the fundamentals of Data Science, encompassing data collection, storage, analysis, and visualization. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will learn to extract insights from complex data sets and develop skills in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data communication. By the end of the course, students will be able to design and implement data-driven solutions to real-world problems.

name: Machine Learning
description: Este curso de Machine Learning (IM712) ofrece una introducción profunda a las técnicas y algoritmos clave de aprendizaje automático, enfocándose en la aplicación práctica de modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas complejos en diversas áreas. Los estudiantes aprenderán a implementar y evaluar modelos de machine learning utilizando herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos avanzadas, y a desarrollar habilidades para analizar y resolver problemas en un entorno de datos grande. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes estarán en posición de aplicar los conceptos de machine learning para abordar problemas reales en su campo de estudio.

name: Machine Learning II Predictive Modelling
description: Cette formation pratique IM716, "Modélisation prédictive par apprentissage automatique II", se concentre sur l'application avancée de techniques d'apprentissage automatique pour développer des modèles prédictifs efficaces. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie de la conception, de la mise en œuvre et de l'évaluation de modèles de machine learning complexes, ainsi que des outils et des méthodes pour améliorer leur précision et leur robustesse.

name: Social Network Data Analytics
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts and methods of social network data analytics, focusing on the extraction, analysis, and interpretation of complex social structures. Through hands-on experience with data visualization and statistical modeling tools, students will learn to identify patterns, trends, and relationships within social networks, and apply these insights to real-world problems and applications.

name: Financial Data Analytics
description: El curso IM720 Financial Data Analytics brinda una visión integral de la toma de decisiones basada en datos en entornos financieros, cubriendo temas clave como la extracción y limpieza de datos, el modelado predictivo y la visualización de datos, para que los estudiantes puedan analizar y resolver problemas financieros complejos. A través de casos de estudio y proyectos prácticos, los estudiantes aprenderán a aplicar herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos para tomar decisiones informadas en el ámbito financiero. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes podrán analizar y comunicar resultados de manera efectiva a audiencias financieras.

name: Social Media Analytics
description: "Cours IM736 : L'analyse de médias sociaux - Ce cours explore les principaux outils et méthodes d'analyse de médias sociaux, permettant aux étudiants de comprendre les comportements et les tendances des utilisateurs sur les plateformes en ligne. Ils apprendront à évaluer les indicateurs clés, à modéliser les réseaux sociaux et à utiliser les outils d'analyse avancés pour prendre des décisions éclairées dans les domaines du marketing, de la communication et de la gestion."

name: Information Industry and Regulation Teaching in English
description: This course examines the intersection of information industries and regulatory frameworks, with a focus on the global context and English-language practices. Students will analyze the impact of regulatory environments on information industries, including emerging technologies, intellectual property, and data governance. Through case studies and theoretical frameworks, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complex relationships between information industries and regulatory regimes.

name: Information and Social Innovation
description: Course IM803 "Información y Innovación Social" examines the intersection of information systems and social innovation, enabling students to develop solutions that address real-world problems and promote positive social change through the strategic use of information technologies.

name: Information Ethics
description: En este curso, IM831 - Ética de la Información, los estudiantes analizarán las implicaciones morales y éticas de la información y las tecnologías digitales, examinando conceptos clave como la privacidad, la confidencialidad, la propiedad intelectual y la libertad de expresión. A lo largo del curso, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades críticas para evaluar dilemas éticos en entornos digitales y aplicar principios éticos para tomar decisiones informadas. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes tendrán una comprensión sólida de la ética de la información y su importancia en un mundo cada vez más digitalizado.

name: Digital Governance
description: This course (IM838) explores the intersection of digital technologies and governance, examining the ways in which digital platforms and tools shape the design and implementation of public policies, institutions, and social relationships in Mexico. Students will analyze case studies and develop critical perspectives on the opportunities and challenges of digital governance, including data-driven decision-making, digital inclusion, and cybersecurity. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and group projects, students will acquire a nuanced understanding of the complex dynamics between technology, politics, and society.

name: Seminar in Advanced Information ManagementI
description: This course delves into the theoretical foundations and practical applications of advanced information management, focusing on the strategic integration of information systems, organizational behavior, and technology in complex business environments. Students will analyze case studies, develop analytical and problem-solving skills, and cultivate expertise in evaluating and implementing innovative information management solutions.

name: Seminar in Advanced Information ManagementII
description: This seminar course explores advanced concepts in information management, focusing on theoretical frameworks and practical applications in the development and implementation of information systems. Students will gain a deeper understanding of organizational information processes, data analytics, and strategic decision-making in the context of information management. Through case studies and group discussions, students will apply theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios.

name: Seminar in Advanced Information ManagementIII
description: This seminar offers advanced students the opportunity to investigate and critically evaluate current trends, technologies, and methodologies in information management. Students will develop their expertise in the design and implementation of information management solutions, considering the intersection of technology, business, and social contexts. Through case studies and practical projects, students will enhance their analytical, leadership, and collaborative skills.

name: CalculusI Teaching in English
description: In this foundational course, Calculus I Teaching in English (IN101), students will develop a rigorous understanding of differential and integral calculus, including limits, differentiation, and integration of functions. Through a combination of theoretical and applied problems, students will learn to model real-world phenomena, optimize functions, and analyze rates of change. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the mathematical tools and techniques necessary for success in mathematics, science, and engineering fields.

name: Introduction to Computer Science Teaching in English
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and practices of teaching computer science, focusing on English language instruction. Topics include curriculum design, pedagogical methods, and assessment strategies for effective computer science education. Upon completion, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills to design and deliver engaging computer science lessons in an English-speaking environment.

name: Computer ProgrammingI Teaching in English
description: This introductory course to computer programming, IN103, provides students with a comprehensive foundation in programming principles, data structures, and algorithmic thinking. Through hands-on experience with a high-level programming language, students will learn to design, develop, and test software solutions to real-world problems, fostering problem-solving skills and computational literacy. By the end of the course, students will be able to write efficient, well-documented code and apply programming concepts to tackle complex challenges.

name: Intellectual Property Teaching in English
description: This course, IN104 Intellectual Property Teaching in English, explores the theoretical fundamentals and practical applications of intellectual property (IP) law and its education in an English-language setting. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of IP principles, including copyright, patent, and trademark law, as well as pedagogical strategies for effective IP teaching.

name: CalculusII Teaching in English
description: This course, Calculus II, provides a comprehensive introduction to techniques of integration, including substitution, integration by parts, and improper integrals. Students will learn to apply these concepts to solve a range of mathematical problems, develop their analytical and problem-solving skills, and prepare for advanced mathematical studies.

name: Discrete Mathematics Teaching in English
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of discrete mathematics concepts and teaching pedagogies, equipping students with the theoretical foundations and practical skills necessary to effectively teach discrete mathematics in English to students. Students will learn to design and deliver engaging lessons, assess student understanding, and develop materials for discrete mathematics education.

name: Computer ProgrammingII Teaching in English 人工智慧投資管院 人工智慧投資學程
description: This course, Computer Programming II, delves into advanced programming concepts, focusing on the application of artificial intelligence in investment and finance. Students will learn to design, develop, and test sophisticated software programs using cutting-edge AI techniques, enhancing their analytical and problem-solving skills. Upon completion, students will be able to integrate AI-driven solutions into investment strategies and decision-making processes.

name: Management Information Systems Teaching in English 人工智慧投資管院 人工智慧投資學程
description: This course, IN110 Management Information Systems Teaching in English, delves into the application of artificial intelligence in investment and management through a comprehensive exploration of management information systems, artificial intelligence investment programs, and related technologies. Students will gain a deep understanding of how to effectively integrate technology and data-driven insights to inform strategic investment decisions, and develop the skills to teach and communicate these concepts to diverse audiences. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will be equipped to excel in the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence and investment management.

name: English Listening and Reading I Teaching in English
description: This fundamental course in English language instruction equips students with the skills and knowledge necessary to teach English listening and reading comprehension to non-native speakers. Students will learn effective teaching methods, assess listening and reading skills, and develop materials to enhance student learning. Throughout the course, they will also explore the complexities of language acquisition and cultural diversity in the EFL classroom.

name: English Listening and Reading II Teaching in English
description: In this course, English Listening and Reading II Teaching in English (IN112), students will develop advanced listening and reading comprehension skills in English, with a focus on pedagogical approaches and materials design for effective instruction. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and practical activities, students will learn to analyze and create engaging lesson plans, assessments, and resources for teaching English language learners. Upon completion, students will be equipped to enhance their teaching practices and create supportive learning environments for English language acquisition.

name: Seminar on Cultural Industries: Theories and Policies
description: This course provides students with an in-depth exploration of the cultural industries from theoretical and policy-oriented perspectives, examining the complex relationships between creativity, economics, and society. Through a critical analysis of case studies and industry trends, students will gain a nuanced understanding of the challenges and opportunities facing the cultural sector, as well as the role of government policies in shaping its development.

name: Introduction to Thesis Writing
description: This course provides students with a foundational understanding of thesis writing, equipping them with essential skills in developing research questions, structuring arguments, and crafting coherent narratives in their native language. Students will gain hands-on experience in writing and revising thesis proposals, learning to critically evaluate existing research and articulate their own contributions to the field. Through guided workshops and peer review, students will refine their writing and editing skills, culminating in a polished thesis proposal.

name: Qualitative Research
description: In this course, IP012 Qualitative Research, students will delve into the principles and methodologies of in-depth qualitative research, examining the complexities of human experiences and social phenomena through diverse qualitative research approaches. Taught in the target language, students will learn to design, conduct, and analyze qualitative studies, developing essential skills in data collection, interpretation, and critical thinking.

name: Seminar in Community, Ethnics, and the Sixth Industries
description: In this seminar, students will explore the interconnected relationships between community, ethnicity, and the Sixth Industries, examining the complex dynamics and challenges that arise from their intersections. Through in-depth discussions and case studies, students will gain a nuanced understanding of the social, economic, and cultural implications of these intersections, and develop critical thinking and analytical skills to navigate their complexities.

name: Independent Research I
description: En esta asignatura de investigación independiente, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades para diseñar, implementar y presentar proyectos de investigación originales bajo la supervisión de un asesor académico. A lo largo de la cursada, los estudiantes analizarán y aplicarán métodos de investigación científica para investigar un tema específico de su interés y contribuir al conocimiento en su campo disciplinario.

name: Seminar in Europe Culture and Creative Industries
description: This seminar delves into the complexities of European culture and creative industries, examining their historical development, current trends, and global implications. Through a combination of theoretical frameworks and case studies, students will gain a nuanced understanding of the intersections between culture, economy, and society in Europe.

name: Seminar in Cultural Governance and Policy
description: This course explores the intersection of culture, governance, and policy, offering students a nuanced understanding of the complex dynamics shaping cultural institutions and practices. Through in-depth analysis and case studies, students will examine the role of policy and governance in cultural development, identifying key challenges and opportunities for cultural innovation and sustainability.

name: Seminar in Cultural Studies
description: In this advanced seminar, students will delve into the complexities of cultural studies, examining the intersections of power, identity, and representation in contemporary societies. Through critical readings and discussions, students will develop a nuanced understanding of cultural phenomena, including media, art, and everyday practices. By engaging with theoretical frameworks and case studies, students will cultivate their analytical and critical thinking skills to interpret and navigate the dynamics of cultural expression.

name: Seminar in Art Festival and Creative City
description: This course explores the multifaceted dynamics of art festivals and creative cities, diving into the cultural, economic, and social implications of urban cultural development. Through discussions, case studies, and critical analyses, students will gain a deeper understanding of the complex relationships between art, space, and community, and learn to evaluate the impact of creative industries on urban environments.

name: EnglishI: Freshmen English ; advanced-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description:
LC101 English I: Freshmen English; Advanced-Level Teaching in English 
This course offers a comprehensive introduction to English language and literature, focusing on critical reading, writing, and communication skills. Students will develop advanced-level proficiency in English through engaging with literary texts, analyzing language structures, and refining their expression in both written and spoken forms.

name: EnglishI: Freshmen English; Intermediate-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description: In this intermediate-level course, English I: Freshmen English; Intermediate-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程 (LC102), students will develop their language proficiency and instructional skills as they explore the intricacies of English language teaching and learning. Through a mix of theoretical foundations, pedagogical techniques, and hands-on practice, students will learn to design and deliver effective English language lessons for diverse learners. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the knowledge, skills, and confidence to teach English in a variety of settings.

name: EnglishI: Freshmen English; Entry-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description: This introductory course, English I: Freshmen English; Entry-level Teaching in English, provides a comprehensive foundation in language and literacy skills for students. Students will develop their writing, reading, and critical thinking abilities, as well as explore effective teaching methods for language instruction, all while fostering a deeper appreciation for the nuances of the English language. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and writing workshops, students will emerge with a solid understanding of language principles and pedagogical practices.

name: EnglishII: Freshmen English ; advanced-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description: In this advanced-level English language teaching course, LC201: English II: Freshmen English ; advanced-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程, students will develop expertise in designing and delivering effective English language instruction to freshmen students, focusing on pedagogical theories, curriculum design, and assessment strategies. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and practical teaching experiences, students will learn to create engaging and culturally responsive learning environments that promote language acquisition and academic success.

name: EnglishII: Freshmen English ; Intermediate-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description: This intermediate-level English course, designed for freshmen, develops advanced language skills and cultural knowledge, emphasizing critical thinking, effective communication, and nuanced understanding of complex texts, literary analysis, and cultural contexts. Through a carefully curated selection of readings, writing assignments, and discussions, students will refine their written and verbal expression, as well as cultivate a deeper appreciation for the diversity of global perspectives and experiences. By the end of the course, students will possess a more sophisticated command of English language and a more informed understanding of the world's cultures.

name: EnglishII: Freshmen English; Entry-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程
description: In this foundational course, LC203 English II: Freshmen English; Entry-level Teaching in English 寰宇文化微學程, students will develop their English language proficiency, explore literary analysis, and examine effective teaching methods, with a focus on cultivating a deeper understanding of cross-cultural communication and pedagogy. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and writing assignments, students will engage with diverse texts, refine their critical thinking and writing skills, and prepare for careers in teaching and education. By the end of the course, students will be well-equipped to navigate the complexities of teaching English to diverse learners.

name: Drama Appreciation
description: In this introduction to Drama Appreciation, students explore the fundamental theories and practices of dramatic art through analysis of significant works, playwrights, and performance styles. Through a critical examination of various genres and traditions, students develop a deeper understanding of the cultural contexts and artistic techniques that shape dramatic expression.

name: Folk Music
description: In this intermediate-level course, LE213 Folk Music, students will delve into the rich cultural heritage of traditional music from around the world, exploring its historical context, social significance, and artistic expression. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will gain a deeper understanding of the unique characteristics and evolution of folk music, as well as its continued relevance in modern society.

name: Aesthetics
description: This course explores the fundamental concepts and theories of aesthetics, examining the relationship between artistic expression, beauty, and the human experience. Students will analyze and critically evaluate various philosophical, historical, and cultural perspectives on aesthetics, developing a deeper understanding of the complex interactions between art, perception, and meaning. Through lectures, discussions, and writing assignments, students will cultivate their critical thinking and analytical skills.

name: Language and Logic
description: In this interdisciplinary course, students will explore the intricate relationship between language and logic, analyzing the fundamental principles of linguistic communication and their logical underpinnings. Through a critical examination of theoretical models and practical applications, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the ways in which language shapes and is shaped by logical structures.

name: An Introduction to Japanese Culture 人文素養與多元創意微學程
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of Japanese culture, delving into its historical context, traditional values, and contemporary expressions. Students will gain a nuanced understanding of the complexities and richness of Japanese society, examining its art, literature, philosophy, and customs through a multidisciplinary lens. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically analyze and appreciate the diversity and innovation of Japanese culture.

name: Classical Music Appreciation
description: In this interdisciplinary course, LE357 Classical Music Appreciation (offered in Spanish), students will delve into the rich history and cultural significance of classical music, exploring the evolution of major forms and styles from the Baroque to the 20th century. Through lectures, discussions, and listening sessions, students will develop a nuanced understanding of classical music's expressive qualities, historical context, and enduring impact on contemporary culture.

name: A Guide to Picture Storybooks
description: In this comprehensive course, LE406: A Guide to Picture Storybooks, students will delve into the world of children's literature, exploring the key elements of picture storybooks, their historical development, and the impact of storytelling on young readers. Through a range of theoretical, creative, and practical perspectives, students will gain a deeper understanding of the power of picture storybooks to shape children's imaginations, values, and literacy skills. Taught primarily in the students' native language, this course prepares students to create engaging and effective picture storybooks for diverse audiences.

name: British History and Culture
description: In this interdisciplinary course (LE418), students explore the rich cultural and historical heritage of Britain from the medieval period to the present day, examining key events, figures, and artifacts that have shaped the country's identity. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and multimedia resources, students will gain a nuanced understanding of British history and its continued influence on contemporary culture, society, and politics. Taught primarily in French, this course provides students with a unique opportunity to engage with British history and culture through a foreign language perspective.

name: Introduction to the Major World Religions
description: This course provides an in-depth examination of the major world religions, including their historical development, core teachings, and cultural significance. Through critical analysis and comparative study, students will explore the complexities and similarities of Buddhism, Hinduism, Christianity, Islam, and Judaism, fostering a deeper understanding of global spiritual diversity.

name: Russian Idea and Culture
description: This course explores the evolution and significance of the Russian Idea, a complex and multifaceted concept that has shaped the nation's cultural identity, politics, and intellectual traditions. Through a close reading of major literary and philosophical works, students will gain a deeper understanding of the cultural, historical, and philosophical contexts that have influenced Russian thought and society.

name: Cultural Relics and Literature 人文素養與多元創意微學程
description: This course, 人文素養與多元創意微學程 (Cultural Relics and Literature), explores the intersection of cultural heritage and literary expression in Taiwan. Students will delve into the historical and cultural contexts of Taiwanese literature, examining the ways in which cultural relics influence literary works and vice versa. Through a multidisciplinary approach, students will develop a nuanced understanding of Taiwan's cultural identity and its literary traditions.

name: Learning I-Ching: Introduction to the Legendary Book of China
description: In this course, LE440 Learning I-Ching: Introduction to the Legendary Book of China, students will delve into the ancient Chinese classic, exploring its history, philosophy, and applications in Chinese culture. Through a comprehensive study of the I-Ching's text, history, and symbolism, students will gain a deeper understanding of the complex relationships between change, harmony, and destiny. By the end of the course, students will be able to interpret and apply the I-Ching's principles in their own lives and contexts.

name: Western Civilization and The Classics Teaching in English
description: In this interdisciplinary course, LE446: Western Civilization and The Classics Teaching in English, students will explore the foundational texts, ideas, and historical contexts of Western culture, examining the enduring legacies of ancient Greece and Rome through a variety of literary, philosophical, and historical sources. Through close readings, comparative analysis, and critical thinking, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the classical roots of Western thought and their ongoing influence on contemporary society.

name: Exploring the Reading Industry Chain
description: This course, Exploring the Reading Industry Chain (LE450), delves into the multifaceted aspects of the publishing market in China, analyzing key components from manuscript creation to dissemination and consumption. Through this course, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the industry dynamics and develop essential skills in market research, industry analysis, and strategic planning.

name: Introduction to Indigenous Peoples' Culture
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the richness and diversity of Indigenous peoples' cultures, traditions, and histories in a global context, examining the complexities of their relationships with the environment, colonizers, and contemporary societies. Through a critical and nuanced approach, students will develop a deeper understanding of the ongoing struggles and triumphs of Indigenous peoples and foster cross-cultural competencies essential for effective engagement and collaboration.

name: Introduction to Life Science Teaching in English
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles and practices of teaching life sciences in an English-speaking environment, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively communicate scientific concepts to diverse learners. Students will explore effective pedagogies, assessment strategies, and cultural considerations in teaching life sciences, as well as develop their own teaching philosophies and practices.

name: Science of Chinese Medicine
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and practices of Chinese medicine, exploring its theoretical frameworks, diagnostic methods, and treatment modalities. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on training, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of traditional Chinese medicine, including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and other therapies. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze and apply Chinese medical concepts to real-world healthcare scenarios.

name: Introduction to Chinese Medicine and Healthcare
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and practices of traditional Chinese medicine, exploring its history, philosophy, and applications in preventive and therapeutic healthcare. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and clinical observations, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of Chinese medical theories, diagnostic methods, and treatment modalities.

name: Introduction to Biology Teaching in English
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles and practices of teaching biology to English-speaking students, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively communicate complex scientific concepts in a clear and engaging manner. Students will explore the fundamentals of biology education, instructional strategies, and assessment techniques, while developing their language proficiency and teaching methodologies.

name: Introduction to Drugs
description: Cette cours d'introduction aux drogues (LS217) explore les principes fondamentaux de la pharmacologie, couvrant les propriétés physico-chimiques et biologiques des substances psychoactives, ainsi que leurs effets sur le corps et le cerveau. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie des mécanismes d'action, des risques associés et des impacts sociaux et médicaux des différentes classes de drogues.

name: Bioethics
description: "In diesem Kurs "Bioethik" (LS223) wird die ethische Dimension der medizinischen Forschung und Praxis untersucht. Studierende werden mit den Grundlagen der Bioethik, den rechtlichen und moralischen Aspekten der Arzt-Patient-Beziehung und der Würde der menschlichen Person vertraut gemacht. Durch eine Analyse von Fallbeispielen und wissenschaftlichen Artikeln lernen sie, ethische Entscheidungen zu treffen und Lösungen für komplexe bioethische Dilemmata zu entwickeln."

name: The Dialogue between Humanities and Sciences on Food
description: This course, "The Dialogue between Humanities and Sciences on Food" (LS228), explores the intersections of food systems, culture, and society through an interdisciplinary lens, combining the insights of humanities and sciences to analyze the complex relationships between food, identity, and the environment. Through lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the multifaceted nature of food and its role in shaping human experiences and ecosystems.

name: Health Management
description: This course provides students with a comprehensive understanding of health management principles and practices, focusing on the delivery of quality healthcare services in a rapidly changing environment. Through a combination of theoretical frameworks and case studies, students will develop the knowledge and skills necessary to manage and lead healthcare organizations effectively.

name: Introduction to Common Diseases
description: In this comprehensive course (LS230), students will delve into the fundamental principles of common diseases, exploring their pathophysiology, diagnosis, and management. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will gain a thorough understanding of prevalent health conditions and develop essential skills for healthcare professionals.

name: Food Safety and Biotechnology
description: "Este curso, LS231, aborda los aspectos fundamentales de la seguridad alimentaria y la biotecnología, analizando la interacción entre los procesos tecnológicos, microbiológicos y químicos que afectan la calidad y seguridad de los alimentos. Los estudiantes podrán comprender y aplicar conceptos teóricos y prácticos para prevenir contaminación, implementar medidas de control y garantizar la cadena de calidad en la industria alimentaria. A través de este curso, los estudiantes adquirirán habilidades para resolver problemas y tomar decisiones informadas en el ámbito de la seguridad alimentaria y la biotecnología."

name: Medicine and Humanities Teaching in English 社會關懷與創意知能微學程
description: In this interdisciplinary program, "Medicine and Humanities Teaching in English 社會關懷與創意知能微學程" (LS233), students will explore the intersection of medicine, social responsibility, and creative expression. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will develop a deeper understanding of the role of humanities in medicine and cultivate skills in teaching and communication in an English-speaking context. By the end of the course, students will be able to effectively integrate humanities and medical knowledge to promote empathy, compassion, and social responsibility in healthcare settings.

name: Introduction to Public Health
description: Cette cours présente les fondements de la santé publique et explore les principaux concepts et approches qui sous-tendent la promotion de la santé et la prévention des maladies. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie de la définition, de l'épidémiologie et de la planification de la santé publique, ainsi que des stratégies de promotion de la santé et de gestion des systèmes de santé.

name: Introduction to Life and Death
description: Diese Einführungskurs "Einführung in Leben und Tod" (LS236) bietet eine umfassende Analyse der bedeutungsvollen Aspekte des Lebens und des Todes im kulturellen, philosophischen und religiösen Kontext. Durch die Erforschung von biologischen, sozialen und spirituellen Aspekten des Lebens und des Todes erwerben Studierende ein differenziertes Verständnis der Komplexitäten menschlicher Existenz.

name: Life and Physical Activity
description: This course explores the relationship between life processes and physical activity, examining the physiological, psychological, and sociological factors that influence an individual's ability to engage in physical activity. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the effects of physical activity on various aspects of life, from childhood to old age, and develop skills to promote healthy lifestyles and physical activity among diverse populations.

name: Health, Leisure and Life
description: This course, "Health, Leisure and Life" (LS241), examines the interconnected relationships between physical and mental well-being, leisure activities, and quality of life. Students will explore the social and cultural determinants of health, leisure practices, and their impact on individual and community health outcomes. Through a critical analysis of relevant theories and case studies, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complex interplay between health, leisure, and life.

name: Introduction to Life Education
description: This course, LS243, Introdução à Educação de Vida, is an interdisciplinary exploration of the fundamental principles and practices of life education. Students will learn to analyze the complex relationships between human development, social constructs, and educational interventions, and develop a critical understanding of the role of education in shaping individual and societal well-being. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will be equipped to design and implement effective life education programs in diverse contexts.

name: Health and Life
description: In this course, LS244, students will explore the complex relationships between health, illness, and the human experience through a holistic lens. Taught in Spanish, the course delves into the social, cultural, and biological determinants of health, equipping students with a nuanced understanding of the dynamics that shape individual and community well-being.

name: Calculus I
description: "ME105: Kalkulus I - Ini merupakan kelas teori dasar yang mengintroduksikan konsep khusus dari kalkulus, termasuk fungsi, limit, derivatif, dan integral. Siswa akan menganalisis prinsip-prinsip dasar kalkulus dan mengembangkan kemampuan untuk menerapkan konsep-konsep ini dalam penyelesaian masalah. Dengan demikian, siswa dapat memahami dasar-dasar analisis matematika yang luas."

name: Calculus II
description: "ME107 Calculus II: Este curso desarrolla conceptos avanzados de cálculo, incluyendo integración, series de Fourier, integración por sustitución y por partes, así como aplicaciones a las ciencias físicas y matemáticas. Los estudiantes aprenderán a evaluar integrales definidas e indefinidas, resolver ecuaciones diferenciales y aplicar herramientas numéricas para resolver problemas complejos. Al final del curso, los estudiantes tendrán una comprensión profunda de los conceptos y técnicas de cálculo para aplicarlos en diversas áreas de estudio."

name: Engineering Materials 全校性跨領域--材料科技學程
description: This course, ME115 Engineering Materials 全校性跨領域--材料科技學程, introduces students to the fundamental principles and applications of various engineering materials, covering their properties, processing, and selection for different engineering applications. Through lectures and discussions, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of materials science and its relevance to real-world engineering problems, enabling them to make informed decisions in material selection and design.

name: General Physics
description: "This course, ME117 General Physics, is an introductory survey of fundamental concepts in physics, including mechanics, thermodynamics, and electromagnetism. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of physical principles and laws, and learn to apply mathematical models to analyze and solve problems in these areas. Through lectures, discussions, and problem-solving exercises, students will cultivate critical thinking and analytical skills in the context of physics."

name: Engineering Drawing
description: In this hands-on course, ME119 "Engineering Drawing," students will develop their technical drawing skills and learn to communicate engineering ideas effectively through 2D and 3D representations. By combining theoretical concepts with practical exercises, students will learn to accurately convey complex designs and specifications, enhancing their problem-solving abilities and communication skills in a technical context.

name: Computer Programming Lab. I 智慧製造學程
description: This course provides hands-on training in computer programming for the development of intelligent manufacturing systems, focusing on the application of programming languages, data structures, and algorithms to solve real-world problems in the manufacturing industry. Students will learn to design, implement, and test software programs, and analyze the results, developing problem-solving skills and expertise in computer-aided manufacturing.

name: Computer Programming Lab. II 智慧製造學程
description: This course, Computer Programming Lab. II 智慧製造學程 (ME124), is a hands-on laboratory experience that deepens students' understanding of programming concepts and their applications in intelligent manufacturing. Through a combination of lectures, group projects, and individual assignments, students will learn to design, develop, and implement practical programming solutions to real-world problems in the field of manufacturing. By the end of the course, students will be proficient in using programming languages to solve complex manufacturing-related tasks.

name: Workshop Practice I
description: In this foundational workshop practice course, students will develop hands-on skills in manufacturing and material processing through project-based learning and practical exercises, with a focus on problem-solving and teamwork. Through hands-on experimentation and guided instruction, students will acquire a solid understanding of workshop safety, measurement, and tool operation, laying the groundwork for future specialization in mechanical engineering.

name: Workshop Practice II
description: "This course (ME126) focuses on the practical application of engineering principles through hands-on workshop exercises, with emphasis on developing problem-solving skills and critical thinking. Students will gain experience in design, prototyping, and testing, as well as learn to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment. Through this course, students will refine their technical skills and prepare for real-world engineering challenges."

name: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
description: In this foundational course, students will be introduced to the principles and concepts of mechanical engineering through a combination of theoretical and practical studies. The course covers fundamental topics such as mechanics of solids, thermodynamics, and kinematics, as well as the application of design principles and problem-solving techniques in mechanical engineering.

name: Applied Mechanics Statics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles and applications of statics, enabling students to analyze and solve problems involving forces, moments, and equilibrium in various engineering systems. Students will learn to apply mathematical techniques to determine stresses, strains, and deformations in structures and mechanisms, developing a solid foundation in the fundamental concepts of applied mechanics.

name: Engineering Mathematics I
description: This foundational course in engineering mathematics introduces students to advanced mathematical concepts and techniques, including differential equations, vector calculus, and linear algebra. Through a combination of lectures, assignments, and problem-solving exercises, students will develop a strong understanding of mathematical principles and their applications in engineering fields. Upon completion, students will be able to analyze and solve complex mathematical problems, preparing them for further study in engineering disciplines.

name: Engineering Mathematics II
description: This course provides a comprehensive exploration of advanced mathematical concepts and techniques, including differential equations, partial differential equations, and linear algebra, with a focus on their applications in engineering fields. Students will develop a deeper understanding of mathematical modeling, analysis, and problem-solving skills, enabling them to tackle complex engineering problems. Through theoretical foundations and practical exercises, students will gain expertise in mathematical tools essential for advanced engineering studies and professional practice.

name: Thermodynamics I 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程
description: ME206 Thermodynamics I 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles and laws of thermodynamics, covering energy conversion, entropy, and the behavior of thermodynamic systems. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and problem-solving exercises, students will develop a deep understanding of thermodynamic concepts and their applications in green energy technologies.

name: Mechanisms Teaching in English
description: This course, ME207: Mechanisms Teaching in English, is a comprehensive introduction to the principles and applications of mechanisms. Students will learn to analyze, design, and optimize mechanical systems, developing problem-solving skills and expertise in the technical specifications and standards governing modern mechanical systems. Through hands-on experiments and case studies, students will gain a deep understanding of mechanisms and their role in engineering and technology.

name: Thermodynamics II 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程
description: This course, Thermodynamics II, is a comprehensive exploration of advanced thermodynamic principles and their applications in green energy technologies. Students will delve into topics such as energy conversion, entropy, and exergy, as well as the design and analysis of various green energy systems. Through theoretical foundations and real-world examples, students will develop a deeper understanding of thermodynamics and its role in sustainable energy solutions.

name: Applied Mechanics Dynamics
description: This advanced course explores the fundamental principles and analytical methods of dynamics, focusing on the application of kinematics and kinetics to solve complex problems in mechanical systems. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of topics such as motion, forces, energy, and vibrations, and will learn to analyze and model real-world systems using mathematical and numerical techniques. Through lectures, assignments, and projects, students will cultivate their problem-solving skills and apply theoretical principles to practical engineering challenges.

name: Introduction to Electric Circuits and Electronics
description: Introdução aos Circuito Elétrico e Eletrônica (ME224): Este curso oferece uma introdução profunda aos princípios básicos dos circuitos elétricos e eletrônicos, incluindo análise de circuitos série e paralelo, teoria de transformadores, componentes eletrônicos e aplicações práticas em eletrônica de consumo. Ao longo do curso, os alunos desenvolverão habilidades para projetar, analisar e simular circuitos elétricos complexos, preparando-os para carreiras em engenharia elétrica e eletrônica.

name: Introduction to Manufacturing Processes 智慧製造學程
description: This course, ME303 智慧製造學程 (Introduction to Manufacturing Processes), provides an in-depth exploration of various manufacturing processes and technologies, enabling students to understand their principles, applications, and impacts on modern industry. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on experiences, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of traditional and emerging manufacturing methods, including machining, casting, forging, and additive manufacturing. By the end of the course, students will be able to design, optimize, and evaluate manufacturing systems, demonstrating their ability to apply theoretical knowledge in practical contexts.

name: Mechanical Engineering Lab.II
description: "ME308: Mechanical Engineering Lab.II - Este curso é destinado a reforçar os conceitos teóricos aprendidos em cursos anteriores, aplicando-os em experimentos práticos e projetos de pesquisa. Alunos aprenderão a analisar e resolver problemas de engenharia utilizando métodos experimentais e a desenvolver habilidades de comunicação eficaz para relatar resultados e conclusões. Ao final do curso, os alunos estarão preparados para abordar desafios em projetos de engenharia reais."

name: Mechanics of Materials 全校性跨領域--材料科技學程
description: This course, ME309: Mechanics of Materials, provides a comprehensive understanding of the mechanical behavior of materials under various types of loading, including tension, compression, shear, and torsion. Students will learn to analyze the strength, stiffness, and stability of materials, as well as the effects of temperature and other environmental factors on material behavior.

name: Mechanical Design II Teaching in English
description: In this advanced course, ME310: Mechanical Design II, students will develop and refine their skills in designing and optimizing mechanical systems, with emphasis on product development, prototyping, and manufacturing processes. Through hands-on projects and case studies, students will learn to apply theoretical concepts to real-world problems, leveraging tools such as computer-aided design (CAD) and finite element analysis (FEA). By the end of the course, students will be able to design and develop innovative mechanical systems, considering factors of functionality, sustainability, and manufacturability.

name: Research Project I 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程
description: ME311 Research Project I 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程: This course is designed to equip students with the skills and knowledge necessary to conduct an independent research project in the field of green energy, focusing on the application of multi-disciplinary approaches to address real-world sustainability challenges. Through a comprehensive research plan and implementation, students will develop expertise in data collection, analysis, and presentation, as well as effective communication and collaboration skills.

name: Heat Transfer Teaching in English
description: This course, ME322 Heat Transfer Teaching in English, delves into the fundamental principles and applications of heat transfer theories, including conduction, convection, and radiation. Through lectures, discussions, and problem-solving exercises, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of heat transfer phenomena and learn to analyze, evaluate, and solve complex heat transfer problems. Upon completion, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills to apply heat transfer principles in various engineering disciplines.

name: Automatic Control 工業4.0－智慧生產學程
description: ME335: Automatic Control - Industry 4.0 - Smart Production Program: This course delves into the principles and applications of automatic control systems, focusing on the integration of advanced technologies and Industry 4.0 concepts to enhance production efficiency and quality in the context of smart manufacturing. Students will learn to design, implement, and optimize control systems using both theoretical and practical approaches.

name: Practice of Mechanical Engineering
description: In this practical-oriented course, students will gain hands-on experience in the application of mechanical engineering principles to real-world problems. Through a combination of laboratory experiments, design projects, and theoretical foundations, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of mechanical engineering systems, design methodologies, and problem-solving techniques. By the end of the course, students will be able to design, analyze, and implement mechanical systems, as well as communicate their results effectively in Spanish.

name: Robot Operating System
description: Este curso introduce a los estudiantes a la arquitectura y funcionalidades del Sistema de Operación de Robots (ROS), un framework de código abierto ampliamente utilizado en la industria de la robótica. A lo largo de este curso, los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar y programar sistemas de control de robots utilizando ROS, incluyendo la integración de sensores, motores y otros componentes. Al final del curso, los estudiantes estarán capacitados para desarrollar aplicaciones de robotica complejas utilizando ROS.

name: Competencies and Key Employability Skills of Mechanical Engineers
description: This course explores the essential competencies and key employability skills required for mechanical engineers in industry and practice, focusing on German language-based applications and real-world challenges. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of technical, business, and communication skills necessary for successful engineering careers. Through case studies and collaborative projects, learners will apply theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios.

name: Computer-Aided Drafting
description: "ME444: Computer-Aided Drafting - Este curso explora as ferramentas e técnicas de projeto assistido por computador, permitindo que os alunos aprendam a criar designs precisos e eficientes em software de desenho assistido por computador, melhorando suas habilidades em modelagem, dimensionamento e análise de projetos."

name: Automotive Engineering
description: El curso de Ingeniería Automotriz (ME470) cubre las últimas tendencias y tecnologías en el diseño, desarrollo y funcionamiento de vehículos. Los estudiantes aprenderán a analizar los sistemas de vehículos, optimizar el rendimiento y la eficiencia, y resolver problemas complejos relacionados con la ingeniería automotriz. A través de un enfoque práctico, los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades para diseñar, prototipar y probar vehículos de manera segura y eficiente.

name: Mechanical Drawing
description: "ME475: Mechanical Drawing - Este curso aborda as principais técnicas e ferramentas necessárias para criar desenhos técnicos precisos e claros, incluindo projetos de máquinas e instrumentos, utilizando ferramentas como papel, lápis e computador. Alunos aprenderão a desenhar componentes mecânicos, sistemas e máquinas complexas, e desenvolverão habilidades para comunicar ideias e conceitos de forma eficaz. Ao final do curso, os alunos estarão capacitados a criar desenhos técnicos de alta qualidade para aplicações industriais."

name: Finite Element Method
description: Cette cours présente l'application de la méthode des éléments finis (MEF) pour résoudre des problèmes de mécanique des solides, de thermique et d'hydrodynamique. Les étudiants apprendront à modéliser et à analyser des systèmes complexes en utilisant des algorithmes et des outils de calcul numérique. Les compétences acquises dans ce cours seront essentielles pour appliquer des méthodes numériques dans divers domaines de l'ingénierie.

name: Electrochemical Engineering 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程
description: This course, Electrochemical Engineering 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程 (ME553), delves into the fundamental principles and applications of electrochemical engineering, with a focus on the development and implementation of sustainable green energy technologies. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical case studies, students will gain a deep understanding of electrochemical reactions, systems, and processes, as well as their potential in addressing global energy and environmental challenges. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze, design, and optimize electrochemical systems for efficient and environmentally friendly energy production.

name: Incineration
description:
Course ME570: Incineration

This course examines la technologie de l'incinération et les aspects environnementaux et économiques associés. Les étudiants apprendront les principes fondamentaux de l'incinération, notamment le fonctionnement des incinérateurs, la gestion des déchets, et les procédures de contrôle de la pollution. Ils acquerront une compréhension approfondie des considérations éthiques et réglementaires entourant l'utilisation de l'incinération comme méthode de gestion des déchets.

name: Fire Protection Engineering
description: Este curso de Ingeniería de Protección contra Incendios (ME577) proporciona una comprensión integral de los principios y métodos para diseñar y evaluar sistemas de protección contra incendios en estructuras y sistemas industriales. Los estudiantes aprenderán a analizar riesgos, diseñar estrategias de evacuación y extinguir incendios, y aplicar la normativa y regulaciones nacionales e internacionales en la materia.

name: Advanced Technologies in Energy and its Applications Teaching in English 全校性跨領域--綠色能源學程
description: This course, ME584 Advanced Technologies in Energy and its Applications, provides an in-depth exploration of cutting-edge technologies driving the transition to sustainable energy systems. Students will learn about innovative energy harvesting, storage, and conversion techniques, as well as their real-world applications and economic viability. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with a comprehensive understanding of the latest developments in green energy and its applications.

name: Robotics 智慧製造學程
description: This course covers the fundamental principles and applications of robotics in 智慧製造學程 (Intelligent Manufacturing), including mechatronics, computer vision, and machine learning. Students will learn to design, develop, and implement robotic systems for manufacturing processes, and analyze the integration of robotics with other technologies for intelligent production. Throughout the course, students will gain hands-on experience with robotics platforms and tools.

name: Introduction to Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology
description: Este curso de introducción a la tecnología de fabricación de semiconductores cubre los principios básicos y técnicas aplicadas en la producción de dispositivos semiconductores. Los estudiantes aprenderán sobre los procesos de purificación de materiales, deposición de capas, etapa de crecimiento, y técnicas de análisis y control calidad. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes tendrán una comprensión integral de la tecnología de fabricación de semiconductores y su importancia en la industria electrónica.

name: Artificial Intelligence Teaching in English 智慧製造學程
description: In this interdisciplinary course, ME613 Artificial Intelligence Teaching in English, students will explore the principles and applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in educational settings, focusing on designing and implementing AI-enhanced curricula for teaching English. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical exercises, students will learn to develop and deploy AI-based instructional tools, fostering innovative and effective language learning experiences.

name: Introduction to Power System Integration
description: "Introduction to Power System Integration (ME614) - Este curso introduce a los estudiantes a las bases de la integración de sistemas de potencia, abordando conceptos fundamental de análisis y diseño de redes eléctricas. Los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades para evaluar y optimizar el comportamiento de sistemas de potencia complejos, incluyendo la integración de fuentes de energía renovable y la gestión de la estabilidad y la eficiencia."

name: Basic biomedical programming I 智慧校園與智慧照護學程
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of biomedical programming, focusing on the application of computational methods in healthcare and medical research. Through hands-on exercises and case studies, students will learn to develop programming skills necessary for data analysis and visualization in the field of biomedical engineering.

name: Basic biomedical programming II 智慧校園與智慧照護學程
description: This course, Basic Biomedical Programming II, focuses on the application of programming concepts in the development of intelligent campus and intelligent care systems, emphasizing hands-on experience with programming languages and tools relevant to biomedical research and healthcare technology. Students will learn to design, implement, and evaluate intelligent systems for data-driven decision-making in various healthcare settings. Through project-based learning, students will develop skills in programming, data analysis, and system development.

name: All-Out Defense Education and Researching of Military - National Defense Policy
description: This course delves into the intricacies of military and national defense policies, examining the theoretical foundations and practical applications of defense strategies. Students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of China's defense policies and theories, as well as the country's defense system, through in-depth analysis and research.

name: All-Out Defense Education and Researching of Military - Defense Mobilization
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of military defense mobilization strategies and tactics, examining the historical and contemporary applications of defense mobilization in various conflict scenarios. Through a critical analysis of military defense theories, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of defense mobilization principles, including resource allocation, operational planning, and crisis management.

name: All-Out Defense Education and Researching of Military – Defense Technology
description: In this comprehensive course, MT112 explores the fundamental concepts and practical applications of military-defense technology, enabling students to understand the strategic and tactical aspects of defense systems. Through a combination of theoretical lectures and hands-on experiments, students will develop a deep understanding of defense technologies and their implementation in real-world scenarios.

name: All-Out Defense Education and Researching of Military- International Situations
description: In this comprehensive course, MT114 delves into the strategic and tactical aspects of military defense, focusing on the dynamics of international situations and their implications on national security. Students will gain a deep understanding of defensive techniques, analyze case studies, and develop research skills to evaluate the complexities of military- international situations.

name: All-Out Defense Education and Researching of Military - All-Out Defense
description: "This course explores the fundamental principles and strategies of All-Out Defense, a comprehensive approach to national security and defense. Students will delve into the theoretical and practical aspects of All-Out Defense, examining its historical development, key concepts, and practical applications in various military contexts. Through in-depth analysis and discussion, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the complex factors influencing All-Out Defense and its role in modern military doctrine."

name: Physical Education
description: "Cours PL101 Enseignement Physique: Ce cours introductif explore les principes fondamentaux de l'éducation physique, couvrant les aspects physiques, psychologiques et sociaux du mouvement. Les étudiants apprendront à concevoir et à exécuter des activités physiques adaptées, à analyser les performances individuelles et en équipe, et à développer une compréhension approfondie des principes de sécurité et de prévention des blessures."

name: Swimming
description: This intermediate-level course, PL211 Swimming, is taught primarily in Spanish and focuses on the technical, tactical, and physical aspects of competitive swimming. Students will learn various strokes, training methods, and conditioning techniques to enhance their swimming efficiency and performance. Through a combination of lectures, practical sessions, and assessments, students will develop a deeper understanding of swimming principles and strategies.

name: Volleyball
description: In this hands-on sports course (PL212), students will develop fundamental volleyball skills through a combination of theoretical instruction and practical training, emphasizing teamwork, physical fitness, and strategic play. The course focuses on the Spanish language, exploring the sport's nuances and terminology, preparing students to participate in international competitions. Through a balanced approach of physical activity and linguistic immersion, students will gain a deep understanding of the sport and its cultural context.

name: Woodball
description: In this hands-on course, students will delve into the fundamentals of Woodball, exploring its history, techniques, and strategies through a combination of theoretical and practical instruction.
