Emphasis will be placed on developing skills in shot-taking, ball-handling, and teamwork, as students learn to apply Woodball principles in real-world situations. Upon completion, students will be able to analyze and improve their own gameplay.

name: Tennis
description: "PL215 Tennis: Este curso explorará las técnicas básicas y avanzadas del tenis, incluyendo análisis de movimiento, tácticas de juego y estrategias de entrenamiento. Los estudiantes desarrollarán habilidades físicas y mentales para mejorar su capacidad de competir en el deporte, y analizarán las condiciones y reglas que rigen la competencia internacional. Al finalizar el curso, los estudiantes tendrán una comprensión profunda del juego del tenis y serán capaces de aplicar sus conocimientos en situaciones reales."

name: Table Tennis
description: This course, Taable Tennis (PL219), covers the fundamentals and techniques of the sport, with a focus on tactics, training methods, and competitive strategies. Students will develop their skills in playing, analysing, and improving at table tennis, while gaining insight into the physical and mental aspects of the sport. Through a combination of practical and theoretical instruction, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the game.

name: Bowling
description: In "Bowling" (PL221), students will delve into the fundamental techniques and strategies of this popular recreational sport, developing their skills in ball handling, stance, and targeting. Through a combination of theoretical and practical instruction, students will learn to analyze and improve their performance, while also exploring the cultural and historical context of bowling as a global phenomenon.

name: Cycling
description: "Coursus PL223 - Cyclisme: Cette formation en français explore les aspects théoriques et pratiques du cyclisme, abordant la physique du vélo, les techniques de conduite et la sécurité routière. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie des principes physiques et de la planification de courses, ainsi que des compétences pratiques pour améliorer leurs performances sur un vélo."

name: Basketball
description: In this intermediate-level course (PL224), students will delve into the theoretical and practical aspects of basketball, exploring its history, rules, strategies, and physical demands. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on training, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the sport and improve their technical skills. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze and apply the key concepts of basketball in practical contexts.

name: Badminton
description: PL225 Badminton: This course introduces students to the fundamental skills and strategies of badminton, covering techniques for hitting, defending, and serving, as well as game tactics and teamwork. Through a combination of theoretical and practical instruction, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the sport and improve their physical and mental fitness.

name: School Sport Team Training
description: Este curso de PL331, Educación Física para Equipos Deportivos Escolares, se enfoca en la formación de habilidades y conocimientos necesarios para la dirección de equipos deportivos escolares exitosos. Los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar y implementar programas de entrenamiento, desarrollar estrategias para mejorar el rendimiento del equipo y crear un ambiente positivo de trabajo en equipo. A través de esta formación, los estudiantes adquirirán habilidades prácticas para liderar y gestionar equipos de deportes en entornos escolares.

name: Health-Related Physical Fitness
description: In this course (PL333), students explore the principles and practices of health-related physical fitness, examining the relationship between physical activity and overall well-being. Through a combination of theoretical and practical studies, students learn to assess, design, and implement effective exercise programs tailored to diverse populations and fitness goals.

name: Free Weight Exercise
description:
PL334 - Free Weight Exercise: 
Esta asignatura proporciona una comprensión profunda de las teorías y prácticas detrás del entrenamiento con pesas libres. Los estudiantes aprenderán a diseñar y ejecutar programas de entrenamiento efectivos, enfocándose en la seguridad, la técnica y el progreso individual.

name: Yoya Fitness
description: This course, Yoya Fitness (PL335), introduces students to the principles and practices of holistic fitness and wellness through the lens of Yoyasan, a unique approach to physical and mental self-cultivation. Students will learn traditional exercises, meditation techniques, and dietary principles to achieve balance and harmony in body, mind, and spirit. Upon completion, students will be equipped to design and implement effective fitness programs incorporating Yoya principles.

name: KENDO
description: In this practical course, students will delve into the traditional Japanese martial art of Kendo, developing fundamental skills in sword handling, footwork, and strategy. Through regular training sessions and theoretical instruction, students will gain a deeper understanding of Kendo's history, philosophy, and techniques, cultivating physical and mental discipline.

name: Pickleball
description: Dans ce cours, les étudiants acquerront les compétences nécessaires pour jouer et apprécier le jeu de Pickle-ball, une sport de raquette à main qui combine les éléments du tennis, du badminton et du squash. Les étudiants découvriront les règles et les stratégies de jeu, et apprendront à analyser et améliorer leur jeu. En fin de cours, les élèves seront capables de participer à des parties de Pickle-ball avec confiance et compétence.

name: Popular Aerobic Dance
description: En este curso, los estudiantes aprenderán técnicas, movimientos y pasos de bailes aeróbicos populares, como Zumba, Hip Hop y Jazz. A lo largo del semestre, explorarán diferentes estilos y ritmos para mejorar su coordinación, equilibrio y condición física. Al finalizar el curso, estarán capacitados para liderar sesiones de baile aeróbico y comprenderán la importancia de la actividad física en la promoción de la salud.

name: Advanced Quality Control Teaching in English
description: This course, PM501 Advanced Quality Control Teaching in English, equips students with the theoretical foundations and practical skills to develop and deliver effective quality control instruction to learners of English as a second language. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on teaching practice, students will learn how to design and implement quality control measures, assess language proficiency, and foster a supportive learning environment. Upon completion, students will be able to critically evaluate and improve their own teaching practices, as well as those of their peers.

name: Data Mining Teaching in English
description: In this advanced course, PM502 Data Mining Teaching in English, students will delve into the principles and techniques of data mining, learning to extract insights from complex datasets and develop effective pedagogical strategies for teaching data mining concepts to diverse learners. Through a combination of theoretical foundations and practical applications, students will gain expertise in data mining methodologies and learn to communicate their findings effectively in English.

name: Analysis of Materials properties Teaching in English
description: In this advanced course, students will engage in a comprehensive exploration of the fundamental properties and behavior of materials, encompassing their mechanical, thermal, electrical, and optical characteristics. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on experiments, participants will develop a deep understanding of material properties and their applications in various engineering disciplines. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically analyze and interpret material properties data, and apply this knowledge to solve real-world problems.

name: Polymer Physics Teaching in English
description: In this advanced course, students will delve into the fundamental principles of polymer physics and learn to effectively communicate complex concepts to various audiences. Through lectures, discussions, and practical applications, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of polymer properties, behavior, and interactions, as well as develop pedagogical skills to teach polymer physics in English.

name: Mandarin Chinese I Teaching in English
description: This foundational course introduces students to the fundamentals of Mandarin Chinese teaching in an English-speaking environment. Students will learn the language's grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation, while exploring effective methods and materials for teaching Chinese to non-native speakers, including lesson planning, classroom management, and cultural awareness. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the skills and knowledge to design and deliver engaging Chinese language lessons.

name: Human Resources Management
description: Esta curso de Gerenciamento de Recursos Humanos (SC121) fornece aos alunos uma compreensão profunda das teorias, ferramentas e práticas utilizadas na gestão de recursos humanos em organizações. Ao longo do curso, os alunos aprenderão a desenvolver habilidades essenciais em recrutamento, seleção, treinamento, desenvolvimento de equipes e gestão de conflitos, bem como a aplicar conceitos de legislação trabalhista e direito laboral.

name: A General Introduction to Volumtary Service 社會關懷與創意知能微學程
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the principles and practices of social concern and community engagement, focusing on the development of creative competencies and problem-solving skills in a Taiwanese context. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and experiential learning, students will gain a deeper understanding of the complexities of social issues and learn to design and implement effective community service projects. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically analyze social problems and develop innovative solutions that promote positive social change.

name: Introduction of Social Work
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental principles and practices of social work, covering the history, theories, and methods of the field. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of the role of social workers in various settings, including assessment, intervention, and advocacy. Through a combination of theoretical and practical perspectives, students will gain the skills and knowledge necessary to embark on a career in social work.

name: Big Data and Policy Analysis Application Basic 「社會數據分析」跨領域微學程 科技與人文相遇微學程 科技與社會微學程 數位人文微學程
description: This course, "Big Data and Policy Analysis Application Basic", is an interdisciplinary program that introduces students to the application of big data analytics in policy analysis, focusing on the integration of technology and social sciences. Through lectures, case studies, and hands-on practice, students will learn to collect, analyze, and interpret large-scale data to inform policy decisions, developing essential skills for careers in data-driven governance and policy development.

name: The Development of Careers II
description: In this advanced course, SC134: The Development of Careers II, students will delve into the complexities of career development, exploring the theoretical frameworks and practical strategies that shape professional growth and identity formation. Through a combination of case studies and experiential learning, students will develop a deeper understanding of the dynamic processes that influence career progression and trajectory. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate the challenges and opportunities of their own career paths.

name: Social Psychology
description: Cette cours explore les mécanismes psychologiques sous-jacents qui façonnent les interactions et les relations sociales. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie de la manière dont les processus cognitifs, affectifs et sociaux influencent le comportement individuel et collectif, ainsi que des stratégies pour améliorer les relations interpersonnelles.

name: Human Behavior in the Environment 老人福祉科技跨域產業學程
description: This course, Human Behavior in the Environment 老人福祉科技跨域產業學程 (SC225), explores the intricate relationships between human behavior, social environments, and physical surroundings, with a focus on the well-being of the elderly in Taiwan. Students will analyze the psychological, sociological, and ecological factors influencing human behavior in various settings, and develop solutions to promote healthy aging and community development. Through case studies and discussions, students will gain a deeper understanding of the complex interplay between human behavior and the built environment.

name: Big Data and Policy Analysis Advanced 「社會數據分析」跨領域微學程
description: In this interdisciplinary advanced course, students will explore the application of big data analytics in policy analysis, examining how large-scale datasets can inform evidence-based decision-making in various fields. Through hands-on exercises and case studies, students will develop skills in data mining, visualization, and statistical modeling to extract meaningful insights from complex social data, ultimately informing policy development and evaluation.

name: Sociology of Consumption
description: In diesem Kurs (Sociologie der Konsumtion, SC320) werden die sozialen Strukturen und Dynamiken hinter der Konsumkultur analysiert. Schwerpunkte liegen auf der Untersuchung von Konsumpraktiken, Marketingstrategien und der sozialen Konstruktion von Bedürfnissen. Durch die Erforschung der Beziehungen zwischen Konsum, Gesellschaft und Kultur, werden die Teilnehmer am Verständnis komplexer sozialer Phänomene teilhaben.

name: Social Stratification & Mobility
description: In this interdisciplinary course, SC330 Social Stratification & Mobility (taught in [language other than English]), students will explore the complex dynamics of social inequality and mobility, examining the structural and institutional factors that shape opportunities for social advancement. Through a critical analysis of theoretical perspectives and empirical research, students will develop a nuanced understanding of social stratification and its consequences for individuals and society.

name: Management of Non-Profit Organizations
description: "This course, SC334 Management of Non-Profit Organizations, covers the strategic and operational management of non-profit organizations, including governance, fundraising, financial management, and leadership. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the complexities and challenges of managing non-profit organizations, and develop the skills necessary to lead and manage effectively in these contexts. Through case studies and real-world examples, students will analyze the management practices of non-profit organizations and develop practical solutions to common challenges."

name: Program Design & Evaluation
description: Dans le cadre de SC343, Program Design & Evaluation, les étudiants apprendront à concevoir et évaluer des programmes efficaces en considérant les dimensions stratégiques, les objectifs, les résultats et les ressources. Ils seront en mesure d'analyser les besoins des clients, de définir des objectifs clairs et de mettre en place des processus d'évaluation pour mesurer le rendement des programmes. Cette formation leur offrira les compétences nécessaires pour concevoir et améliorer des programmes adaptés aux besoins des diverses populations.

name: The Development of Careers VI
description: In this advanced course, The Development of Careers VI (SC346), students delve into the complexities of professional growth and career advancement in a multicultural context. Through case studies, group discussions, and reflective exercises, students analyze the factors influencing career development, design strategic career plans, and develop essential skills for adapting to changing professional landscapes.

name: Social Research MethodsII
description: In questa seconda parte del corso di Social Research Methods, gli studenti approfondiranno gli strumenti e le tecniche utilizzate per la ricerca e l'analisi dei dati sociali. Attraverso esercitazioni pratiche e casi di studio, svilupperanno competenze per la progettazione, l'esecuzione e la valutazione di ricerche empiriche.

name: Sociological Theory
description: This course, "Teoriya Sotsiologii" (Sociological Theory), SC501, provides an in-depth examination of foundational sociological theories and concepts, enabling students to critically evaluate and apply theoretical frameworks to contemporary social phenomena. Through a comprehensive exploration of classical and contemporary sociological thought, students will develop a nuanced understanding of social structure, institutions, and the complexities of human interaction.

name: Qualitative Research
description: In this course, SC515 Qualitative Research, students will explore the theoretical foundations and practical applications of qualitative research methodologies, examining the nuances of data collection, analysis, and interpretation in various social science contexts. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on exercises, students will learn to critically evaluate and conduct qualitative research, developing skills in data triangulation, thematic coding, and narrative analysis. By the end of the course, students will be equipped to design, implement, and report on qualitative research studies in their chosen fields.

name: Survey Research
description: In this course, SC516 Survey Research, students will delve into the fundamental principles and practices of survey research, including research design, sampling methods, data collection, and data analysis techniques. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on exercises, students will learn how to design, implement, and interpret surveys effectively, developing essential skills for evidence-based decision-making and research in various fields.

name: Introduction to Thesis Writing
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of thesis writing in the context of [insert language here, e.g., Spanish, French, or German]. Students will learn how to structure and develop their research ideas, navigate the thesis writing process, and effectively communicate their findings in a clear and concise manner.

name: Special Topics on Social Policy
description: This course, SC528 Special Topics on Social Policy, examines the complexities of social policy in a global context, focusing on the intersection of economic, political, and social factors that shape policy-making and implementation. Through critical analysis and case studies, students will develop a nuanced understanding of social policy issues and acquire skills in policy evaluation and development.

name: Special Topics on Sociology of Family
description: In this course (SC537), students will delve into the complexities of family structures and dynamics through a sociological lens, examining the ways in which societal factors influence family relationships and experiences. Course topics may include family forms, family change, and the impact of social inequality on family life. Through a rigorous exploration of theoretical frameworks and empirical research, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the sociology of family.

name: Special Topics on Social Statistics
description: This course, "Special Topics on Social Statistics" (SC550), explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of statistical analysis in the social sciences. Students will gain a deeper understanding of statistical concepts and methods, including data collection, descriptive analysis, inferential statistics, and data visualization, to critically evaluate and communicate complex social data.

name: Selected Topics in Sustainability and Corporate Social Responsibility
description: This course explores contemporary issues in sustainability and corporate social responsibility, examining the intersection of business, ethics, and environmental stewardship. Through case studies, theoretical frameworks, and real-world applications, students will gain a nuanced understanding of the complex challenges and opportunities in this field. By the end of the course, students will be able to critically analyze and develop effective strategies for sustainable business practices.

name: Special Topics on Public Administration
description: This course, SC562 Special Topics on Public Administration, delves into the intricacies of public sector management, exploring the theoretical frameworks and practical applications that underpin effective governance. Through a mix of lectures, discussions, and case studies, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the challenges and opportunities facing public administrators, and cultivate the skills necessary to analyze and address complex policy issues.

name: Selected Topics in Social Enterprise
description: In this course, SC564 Selected Topics in Social Enterprise, students will delve into the intersection of business and social impact, exploring key concepts, models, and best practices in social entrepreneurship. Through case studies and interactive discussions, students will develop a nuanced understanding of the challenges and opportunities facing social enterprises, and learn to critically evaluate their strategic and operational decisions.

name: Special Topics on Topics on Professional Ethics and Decision-Making
description: This course, "Temas Especiales en Ética Profesional y Tomada de Decisiones", examines the complexities of professional ethics and decision-making in various contexts, exploring the intersection of personal and organizational values with professional responsibilities. Students will develop critical thinking skills to navigate ethical dilemmas and learn to apply theoretical frameworks to real-world scenarios. Through case studies and interactive discussions, students will cultivate informed decision-making and effective communication skills in a culturally aware and globally interconnected environment.

name: Special Topics on Medical Care and Health
description: This course, SC572, explores specialized topics in medical care and health, focusing on current issues and research in the field. Students will delve into the complexities of healthcare systems, policies, and practices, developing a nuanced understanding of the social, economic, and cultural factors shaping medical care. Through a comprehensive examination of theoretical and practical applications, students will gain a deeper appreciation for the multifaceted nature of healthcare.

name: Special Topics on Public Policy
description: This course, offered in the university's native language, explores contemporary issues in public policy through a critical analysis of theoretical frameworks and case studies. Students will examine the development and implementation of public policies, analyzing their impact on societal structures and individual outcomes.

name: Special topics on Population Studies and Policies
description: This course explores key concepts and debates in population studies, examining the complex relationships between demographic trends, economic development, and social policies. Through a critical analysis of theoretical frameworks and case studies, students will gain a nuanced understanding of population dynamics and develop skills to design and evaluate policies addressing population-related challenges.

name: Social Psychology
description: Cette cours examine les principes fondamentaux de la psychologie sociale, comprenant les dynamiques de groupe, l'influence sociale, la persuasion, les relations interpersonnelles et les effets de la situation sur le comportement humain. Les étudiants acquerront une compréhension approfondie des mécanismes psychologiques sous-jacents qui façonnent les interactions sociales et les décisions individuelles. Au cours de ce cours, les étudiants apprendront à analyser et à appliquer les concepts de la psychologie sociale dans des contextes réels.

name: Nursing Professional Career Development
description: In this course, SN004 - Nursing Professional Career Development, students explore the complexities of professional practice in nursing, developing essential skills in leadership, communication, and evidence-based care to enhance their career prospects and contribute to high-quality patient care. Through interactive learning experiences, students will analyze the role of nurses in various healthcare settings, develop strategies for career advancement, and cultivate critical thinking to address real-world challenges.

name: Health Promotion & Healthy Life
description: In this course, students will examine the principles and practices of health promotion and healthy living, exploring the social and cultural factors that influence health outcomes. Through a comprehensive approach, students will learn to design and implement effective health promotion programs, analyze the impact of lifestyle choices on physical and mental well-being, and develop strategies for healthy aging and disease prevention.

name: Complementary and Alternative Medicine
description: In this interdisciplinary course, SN007, students explore the concepts and practices of Complementary and Alternative Medicine (CAM) from a holistic perspective, examining the cultural, historical, and scientific contexts of various therapies and interventions. Through lectures, discussions, and case studies, students gain a nuanced understanding of the principles and applications of CAM, including its interactions with conventional Western medicine.

name: Nursing Technology and Practical Applications
description: In this comprehensive course (SN021: Nursing Technology and Practical Applications), students will delve into the integration of technology and nursing practices, exploring the theoretical foundations and practical applications of various healthcare systems and medical devices. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and hands-on training, students will develop a deeper understanding of the role of technology in modern nursing and enhance their skills in using cutting-edge technologies to deliver high-quality patient care.

name: Anatomy
description: SN101 Anatomy: Este curso de anatomía proporciona una comprensión profunda de la estructura y función del cuerpo humano, cubriendo los sistemas y órganos en detalle y explorando los conceptos clave de la anatomía descriptiva y funcional. A través de lecciones, ejercicios prácticos y actividades interactivas, los estudiantes adquirirán habilidades para describir y visualizar la anatomía de manera precisa y aplicarla en contextos clínicos y científicos.

name: Physiology
description: In this foundational course, "Fisiologia" (SN102), students will delve into the intricacies of physiological processes in living organisms, exploring the mechanisms governing homeostasis, circulation, nervous system function, and other essential biological systems. Through lectures, discussions, and hands-on activities, students will develop a comprehensive understanding of physiological principles and their applications in various fields. By course completion, students will be equipped to analyze and interpret physiological phenomena, fostering a strong foundation for further studies in medicine, biology, and related disciplines.

name: Introduction to Nursing 智慧校園與智慧照護學程
description: This course, SN103 Introduction to Nursing 智慧校園與智慧照護學程, is an introductory module that explores the fundamental concepts and principles of nursing practice in the context of intelligent campus and intelligent care. Students will learn about the nursing process, patient assessment, and care planning, as well as the application of technology in nursing education and practice. Through a combination of theoretical and clinical instruction, students will develop a solid foundation in nursing knowledge and skills.

name: Organic & Biochemistry
description: In this comprehensive course, SN104 Organic & Biochemistry explores the fundamental principles of organic and biochemistry, covering the structure and properties of biomolecules, metabolic pathways, and the chemical reactions that govern living systems. Through a combination of lectures and discussions, students will develop a deep understanding of the molecular basis of life and learn to apply biochemical concepts to real-world problems. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze and interpret biochemical data, think critically about complex biological systems, and communicate their knowledge effectively.

name: Microbiology & Immunology
description: In this undergraduate course, SN105 Microbiologie et Immunologie, students will explore the fundamental principles of microbiology and immunology, delving into the structure, function, and interactions of microorganisms and the human immune system. Through a combination of lectures, discussions, and laboratory activities, students will gain a comprehensive understanding of microbial diversity, pathogenicity, and the mechanisms of host defense. By the end of the course, students will be able to analyze the complex relationships between microorganisms and the human body.

name: Nursing Ethics and Legal Fundamentals 智慧校園與智慧照護學程
description: This course, SN106 Nursing Ethics and Legal Fundamentals 智慧校園與智慧照護學程, explores the intersection of ethics and law in nursing practice, equipping students with the knowledge and skills to navigate complex moral and legal dilemmas in healthcare settings, and ultimately enhance their professional competence and decision-making. Through a critical examination of various case studies and scenarios, students will develop a deep understanding of the legal and ethical frameworks that govern nursing practice, enabling them to provide high-quality, patient-centered care.

name: Human Development 智慧校園與智慧照護學程
description: This course, Human Development 智慧校園與智慧照護學程 (SN203), explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of human development across the lifespan, with a focus on the intersection of education and care. Students will examine the psychological, social, and cultural factors that influence human development, and learn about evidence-based practices in promoting optimal development in various settings. Through a comprehensive understanding of human development, students will develop skills in designing and implementing effective educational and care programs.
